fact_check_explanation_summary: A video purporting to show Storm Eunice arriving early actually shows a tragedy in Poland that happened on Thursday.

fact_check_explanation_title: US defence data showing rise in diseases in 2021 was produced in error
fact_check_explanation_summary: The data has been cited by some to suggest Covid-19 vaccines are behind what are unrealistically large rises in the incidence of various diseases in the US military.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pfizer’s Covid-19 vaccine does not cause birth defects
fact_check_explanation_summary: Participants in the original vaccine trial were required not to have unprotected sex for 28 days after their second dose, but this is just a standard precaution in new drug …

fact_check_explanation_title: More older people have financial debt—but fewer are actually struggling
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article in the Express used accurate figures from Labour showing more pensioners are in debt, but that doesn’t mean that more pensioners have a debt problem.

fact_check_explanation_title: Warning that vigorous duvet-shaking can raise risk of heart attack is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: A screenshot circulating on social media looks like an ITV News article, but isn’t genuine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Potential Covid-19 vaccine which used HIV protein was never rolled out
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims there is HIV in Covid-19 vaccines is false, and refers to a vaccine abandoned at the trial stage which did use a small piece of protein from HIV.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccines don’t cause immunodeficiency syndrome
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that vaccines are harming immune systems is based on flawed analysis comparing Covid-19 case rates between vaccinated and unvaccinated people.

fact_check_explanation_title: ‘BBC article’ claiming shallow breathing increases risk of heart attack is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some social media users are sharing news stories, both real and fake, about possible risk factors for heart attacks to make incorrect claims about the risks of Covid-19 vaccines.

fact_check_explanation_title: Bill Gates didn’t say all Covid-19 vaccines should be withdrawn
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post falsely claims the Microsoft founder wanted all Covid vaccines removed from use

fact_check_explanation_title: Wales and Scotland are getting money to fund a council tax rebate
fact_check_explanation_summary: Welsh First Minister Mark Drakeford and Scottish Finance Secretary Kate Forbes said the countries would not be receiving more money as other areas of their provisional budgets are being revised …

fact_check_explanation_title: US data doesn’t prove increase in cancer following vaccine rollout
fact_check_explanation_summary: The blog post making these claims is based on false US military data.

fact_check_explanation_title: The government hasn’t admitted Covid-19 vaccines damage your natural immune system
fact_check_explanation_summary: This seems to be based on misinterpretations of government reports.

fact_check_explanation_title: Offer of Santorini holiday ‘reward’ returns to Facebook
fact_check_explanation_summary: An almost identical fake offer of a free holiday to Santorini has been shared on Facebook before.

fact_check_explanation_title: Germ theory is not ‘a lie’
fact_check_explanation_summary: The idea that microscopic organisms cause many diseases, which humans often pass on to one another, is an established scientific fact.

fact_check_explanation_title: Picture of tractors in the Netherlands has nothing to do with Canada ‘freedom convoy’
fact_check_explanation_summary: The photo was taken in 2019, and has nothing to do with current protests against vaccine mandates in Canada.

fact_check_explanation_title: McDonald’s doesn’t use mechanically separated chicken
fact_check_explanation_summary: Mechanically separated chicken is obtained when unboned chicken is forced through a sieve to separate meat from bone. McDonald’s makes its nuggets with ground chicken not prepared in this way.

fact_check_explanation_title: Moving ‘crisis actor’ in body bag is actually climate change protester
fact_check_explanation_summary: People shown lying on the ground to protest climate policy were not crisis actors caught unawares.

fact_check_explanation_title: No link between Covid-19 vaccines and new HIV strain
fact_check_explanation_summary: A newly discovered variant of HIV, thought to have first arisen around 30 years ago, is being falsely linked to Covid-19 vaccinations.

fact_check_explanation_title: Income tax, fuel tax and inheritance tax all existed 100 years ago
fact_check_explanation_summary: A number of the taxes listed in the Facebook post don’t even exist in the UK.

fact_check_explanation_title: Rain tornado off Jersey is CGI
fact_check_explanation_summary: A clip of a column of rain descending from the sky and swirling like a tornado was created with CGI and is not real.

fact_check_explanation_title: Photo of Meryl Streep on the subway is not after King Kong audition
fact_check_explanation_summary: This picture was taken five years after King Kong came out, when Ms Streep was already a successful actress.

fact_check_explanation_title: Mirror’s claim that households will be £2,000 a year poorer overstates impact of inflation
fact_check_explanation_summary: Its estimate combined various price rises and the fall in real wages. But this effectively counts some rising prices twice.

fact_check_explanation_title: Keanu Reeves did not say ‘humanity is showing signs of breaking free from the matrix’
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s no evidence the star of the Matrix franchise ever said humanity was being kept in a ‘mental prison’ by elites.

fact_check_explanation_title: NHS video overstates the risk of Covid-19 to children
fact_check_explanation_summary: A doctor in the video said that one in 100 children with Covid-19 get sick enough to go to hospital. The real risk is probably a fraction of that.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral posts about £49 fuel vouchers are false
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that struggling households are entitled to almost £100 in fuel vouchers annually have been shared thousands of times.

fact_check_explanation_title: False US military health data misrepresented as NHS figures
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Instagram claims that infertility and neurological conditions have increased by more than 400%.

fact_check_explanation_title: We don’t know how many children aren’t on school rolls
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Children’s Commissioner for England recently claimed that 80,000 to 100,000 children weren’t on any school roll.

fact_check_explanation_title: Australian police taking no action over politician ‘arrest warrants’
fact_check_explanation_summary: New South Wales police were given documents from a protest group but say they are planning no further action.

fact_check_explanation_title: West Yorkshire Police is not investigating the Covid-19 vaccine programme
fact_check_explanation_summary: Numerous Facebook posts incorrectly claim the Covid-19 vaccine programme is being investigated by West Yorkshire Police.

fact_check_explanation_title: Jacob Rees-Mogg wrong to suggest morning after pill is ‘abortifacient’
fact_check_explanation_summary: Jacob Rees-Mogg appeared to refer to the morning after pill as an ‘abortifacient’ in parliament. That’s not what it is.

fact_check_explanation_title: GP’s article overstates the number of Covid-19 deaths in children
fact_check_explanation_summary: An estimate of at least 133 deaths includes 18- and 19-year-olds, and some which may have had a different underlying cause.

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaccinated Brits won’t have AIDS by the end of February 2022
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article posted on Facebook makes baseless claims that vaccines cause AIDS and will lead to a huge number of deaths in children.

fact_check_explanation_title: Rishi Sunak wrong to say we’ve had a ‘colder  than usual’ winter
fact_check_explanation_summary: So far UK temperatures have been milder than usual, according to the Met Office.

fact_check_explanation_title: Estimates of heart condition prevalence in the UK isn’t linked to vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video wrongly implies the results of a new study looking at how many people may need treatment for a heart condition has only appeared since people started getting the …

fact_check_explanation_title: Higher number of reported Covid-19 deaths down to backlog
fact_check_explanation_summary: The unusually high number came from a backlog in the death reporting system. The average number of daily Covid-19 deaths is currently around 243 and falling.

fact_check_explanation_title: Michael Gove incorrect to say 97% of PPE procured 'fit-for-purpose'
fact_check_explanation_summary: Michael Gove claimed 97% of PPE procured was fit-for-purpose and on the front line. In actual fact, while it may have been usable by someone, not all of it was …

fact_check_explanation_title: Government website makes percentage error on National Insurance rise
fact_check_explanation_summary: Multiple government web pages make the technically inaccurate claim that planned National Insurance contributions are going to rise by 1.25%, when it’s actually a percentage point increase.

fact_check_explanation_title: A surgeon made several incorrect claims about Covid-19 vaccine on GB News
fact_check_explanation_summary: Ahmad Malik has misused various different sources to falsely suggest that the vaccines are dangerous.

fact_check_explanation_title: A needle cannot save the life of someone having a stroke
fact_check_explanation_summary: If you think someone is having a stroke, it’s vital you call 999 as soon as possible.

fact_check_explanation_title: What did Boris Johnson tell MPs about the alleged 13 November Downing Street party?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The release of Sue Gray’s report has led to a renewed focus on comments made by the PM in December.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video filmed at police station is filled with Covid-19 vaccine misinformation
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video shared on Facebook of police speaking to vaccine sceptics is littered with unfounded claims about a non-existent investigation into Covid vaccinations.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims Covid-19 vaccines have led to five times more deaths than other vaccines are based on false assumptions
fact_check_explanation_summary: It has been misleadingly claimed that the UK has recorded five times more deaths ‘due to’ the Covid-19 vaccines than all other vaccines over the past five years.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook video on unvaccinated people makes incorrect claims about DNA
fact_check_explanation_summary: The clip claims that Covid-19 vaccines can alter a person’s DNA.

fact_check_explanation_title: Alex Belfield is wrong to say that only 17,500 people died of Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: More than 140,000 people have died of Covid-19 in England and Wales so far.

fact_check_explanation_title: Highway Code changes infographic needs context
fact_check_explanation_summary: An infographic summarising five changes to the Highway Code is largely based in fact but excludes some important context.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccines don’t make you a ‘ticking time bomb’
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is no evidence that they cause cancer. In very rare cases, there is a link to blood clots, but the benefits of vaccination generally far outweigh the risks.

fact_check_explanation_title: Spanish Flu pandemic wasn’t caused by a meningitis vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: Experts say that there is ‘no way’ that a meningitis vaccine could contribute to starting a flu epidemic.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fake Sky News tweet claims PM drank with foxhound pack
fact_check_explanation_summary: No such story about Boris Johnson and the Berkeley Hunt has been reported.

fact_check_explanation_title: Rubbing hydrogen peroxide over your body every day does not treat cancer
fact_check_explanation_summary: A clip shared on social media makes the potentially harmful claim that hydrogen peroxide rubbed on the skin kills cancer.

fact_check_explanation_title: The ONS has not said only 6,183 people have died of Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: This figure is the number of people in England and Wales who, up to the end of 2021, died of Covid-19 where Covid-19 was the only condition listed on their …

fact_check_explanation_title: PCR inventor Kary Mullis quote doesn’t prove the tests are useless
fact_check_explanation_summary: A quote from the creator of the PCR process, Kary Mullis, is being used to claim PCR testing can find “anything in anybody”.

fact_check_explanation_title: Dan Wootton and David Davis make incorrect claims about Covid-19 deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: Data from the ONS shows that to the end of September 2021, 17,371 people died in England and Wales of Covid and had no pre-existing conditions.

fact_check_explanation_title: Parents mostly against face masks in classrooms
fact_check_explanation_summary: A recent poll found two thirds of parents of secondary school pupils were against mask wearing in classrooms, but the results may not be representative of parents generally.

fact_check_explanation_title: NHS poster about Bell’s palsy and vaccines is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: A fake poster warning about vaccines “causing” Bell’s palsy has been shared online.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fake government guidance is wrong about face masks and equality laws
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Instagram misquotes sections of the Equality Act.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccines haven’t caused an increase in cases and deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: Misleading headlines shared on social media come from an unpublished study which has been strongly criticised by experts.

fact_check_explanation_title: Photos of swimming pool with social distancing screens is genuine
fact_check_explanation_summary: Photos shared on Facebook show a swimming pool where users have to stand between social distancing screens in the water.

fact_check_explanation_title: Klaus Schwab is not related to the Rothschild family
fact_check_explanation_summary: An Instagram post incorrectly claims that World Economic Forum founder Klaus Schwab is related to the Rothschild family.

fact_check_explanation_title: Dover lorry queues can be seen from space, like most UK traffic can
fact_check_explanation_summary: Posts on Facebook claim that the queues of lorries at Dover were longer than the Channel and could be seen from space at one point.

fact_check_explanation_title: Samuel L. Jackson is not in photo of Martin Luther King playing pool
fact_check_explanation_summary: A photo posted on Facebook of Dr Martin Luther King Jr. playing pool incorrectly claims Samuel L. Jackson can be seen in the background.

fact_check_explanation_title: Tweet claiming three child deaths from vaccines in Australia is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: A tweet purporting to come from an Australian health official claimed three children had died of Covid-19 vaccines in Australia. This is false and the tweet is fake.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pfizer’s CEO has had Covid-19 vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video of Albert Bourla saying he hasn’t been vaccinated for Covid-19 yet is from December 2020.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccines are not associated with developing neurodegenerative diseases
fact_check_explanation_summary: The MHRA has told Full Fact there is ‘no credible evidence’ for this.

fact_check_explanation_title: Nadine Dorries wrong to claim employment higher than pre-pandemic level
fact_check_explanation_summary: The number of employees is higher than it was pre-pandemic, but the total number of workers, including the self-employed, is lower than it was.

fact_check_explanation_title: Estimates of 650,000 annual flu deaths can’t be compared to Covid-19 deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: The WHO estimated in 2017 that there are 290,000 to 650,000 flu-related deaths each year.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Australian child ‘Lachlan Leary’ died from vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook comment about the seven-year-old boy has been shared thousands of times online.

fact_check_explanation_title: Met Police has not launched an investigation into the Covid-19 vaccine programme
fact_check_explanation_summary: Posts on Facebook falsely claim that the Metropolitan Police is investigating the Covid-19 vaccine programme.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson’s PPE figures don’t tell the whole story
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Prime Minister claimed during PMQs that the UK is now capable of producing 80% of its own PPE.

fact_check_explanation_title: Japan has never enforced a Covid-19 vaccine mandate
fact_check_explanation_summary: An Instagram post claims that Japan has dropped Covid-19 vaccine mandates even though it has never enforced one.

fact_check_explanation_title: An Instagram post underestimates Covid-19 deaths among younger people
fact_check_explanation_summary: Just over 17,000 people under 65 died of the disease in England and Wales, up to the end of November 2021.

fact_check_explanation_title: PM misleads on employment figures, again
fact_check_explanation_summary: The number of people in work is about 600,000 lower than it was before the pandemic.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Nuremberg Code doesn’t state that mask mandates are a war crime
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Code, which was created in response to human experimentation in Nazi concentration camps, does not mention masks.

fact_check_explanation_title: Argos isn’t selling microwaves for £1.78
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post falsely claims Argos is selling microwaves for £1.78 after it broke a contract with Samsung.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Covid-19 vaccines don’t have ‘negative efficacy’
fact_check_explanation_summary: Data from the UKHSA vaccine surveillance report cannot be used to estimate effectiveness correctly—as the report itself makes clear many times.

fact_check_explanation_title: Dialling 55 during 999 call won’t automatically send police to your location
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post incorrectly claims that dialling 55 when on a 999 call will automatically send the police to where you are without you having to speak.

fact_check_explanation_title: Cheetahs race greyhounds, sometimes
fact_check_explanation_summary: While some cheetahs have not performed when raced against greyhounds, there’s no evidence this is because they consider themselves better than greyhounds.

fact_check_explanation_title: NASA hasn’t ‘just’ hired 24 theologians to study future discovery of aliens
fact_check_explanation_summary: The space agency funded a study programme for 24 theologians which ended in 2017.

fact_check_explanation_title: A Covid-19 patient on BBC News is not a ‘crisis actor’
fact_check_explanation_summary: He was genuinely ill at the time of the interview, and later added the words “crisis actor” to his Instagram profile as a joke.

fact_check_explanation_title: A video of several fans making a paper plane fly is CGI
fact_check_explanation_summary: The video appears on Facebook with the caption “when physicists get bored”.

fact_check_explanation_title: Lemonade and Fanta don’t test positive for Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: Testing lateral flows with random things produces an invalid result.

fact_check_explanation_title: Express overstates Brexit trade deal value, again
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Express claimed that post-Brexit, the UK has struck new free trade deals with 70 countries worth over £760bn. This is the total value of trade with these countries, not …

fact_check_explanation_title: The CDC has not ‘dropped’ all PCR tests
fact_check_explanation_summary: One type of PCR test has been ‘dropped’ in favour of others that are more efficient and can be processed more quickly.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims on ‘Colston Four’ case leave out key questions the jury had to answer
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that what the four defendants admitted to did legally amount to criminal damage omit key parts of the definition of the offence.

fact_check_explanation_title: Doctor who challenged Sajid Javid made misleading claims about vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: A doctor who challenged Sajid Javid on live TV misleadingly suggested Covid-19 vaccines are less effective than the evidence suggests.

fact_check_explanation_title: UKHSA data reaffirms that vaccines work against Omicron
fact_check_explanation_summary: An online article has again misinterpreted data from the UKHSA to claim vaccines don’t prevent Covid-19 hospitalisation and death.

fact_check_explanation_title: UK is fastest growing G7 economy by one measure, and fifth by another
fact_check_explanation_summary: Economic growth between the third quarter of 2020 and 2021 was the highest in the G7. The UK’s growth between the second and third quarter of 2021 placed fifth.

fact_check_explanation_title: Breastfeeding linked to reduced risk of heart disease
fact_check_explanation_summary: A study finding a link between breastfeeding and a reduced risk of heart disease could not confirm whether there was a causal link between the two.

fact_check_explanation_title: Soft drinks shouldn’t be ‘tested’ with lateral flow tests  and asymptomatic transmission is not ‘quackery’
fact_check_explanation_summary: We have written about similar false claims many times before.

fact_check_explanation_title: What were the rules on outdoor parties in May 2020?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Large gatherings in public spaces were certainly not allowed, but Downing Street is also a workplace, so other rules may have applied.

fact_check_explanation_title: Control swabs aren’t meant to be used for patient testing
fact_check_explanation_summary: Lateral flow control swabs are used to check that the test is working properly and should not be used for patient testing.

fact_check_explanation_title: Betty White did not get a Covid-19 booster vaccine three days before she died
fact_check_explanation_summary: Multiple social media posts falsely report actress Betty White had her third Covid vaccine three days before she died.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson misspoke about unvaccinated people in ICU
fact_check_explanation_summary: Around 90% of Covid ICU admissions have not received a booster, but only about 61% are not vaccinated at all.

fact_check_explanation_title: We don’t know how many suicides there have been since Omicron arrived in the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s a big lag on figures due to deaths being investigated by coroners.

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaccinated Germans won’t have AIDS by the end of January 2022
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article by The Expose uses inaccurate figures and flawed calculations to incorrectly claim that Covid vaccines cause AIDS.

fact_check_explanation_title: A Guido Fawkes ‘fact check’ incorrectly claims the SNP is wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: The SNP quoted Covid-19 figures from the ONS correctly.

fact_check_explanation_title: TikTok joke about masks in Zoom meetings is taken seriously on Facebook
fact_check_explanation_summary: This comes from a satirical account in the US. It isn’t true.

fact_check_explanation_title: Are lateral flow test results included in headline Covid-19 case figures?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Reported positive lateral flow tests are included in the UK’s overall Covid case figures for England and Northern Ireland, but are not currently being included in Scotland and Wales.

fact_check_explanation_title: A giant asteroid isn’t about to ‘crash into the Earth’s atmosphere’
fact_check_explanation_summary: The closest the asteroid in question will come to the Earth’s surface is 3.5 million miles away.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence masks limit oxygen for children
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Instagram claims masks ‘do nothing’ but limit oxygen flow and increase risk of bacteria and illness.

fact_check_explanation_title: Is income inequality falling?
fact_check_explanation_summary: While the Prime Minister claimed income inequality was falling, the latest analysis suggests it may be rising again after income support schemes were removed.

fact_check_explanation_title: Egyptian man did not give partner jewellery  made from his teeth
fact_check_explanation_summary: Incorrect claims a man gave his partner jewellery made from his teeth stemmed from an online joke.

fact_check_explanation_title: Telegraph wrong to claim removing PCR requirement will shorten self-isolation period
fact_check_explanation_summary: For people without symptoms, self-isolation begins from the date of the first test which returned a positive result, whether that was a lateral flow or PCR test.

fact_check_explanation_title: Did Chris Whitty say you should keep testing after day 10 of isolation?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The DHSC and the Chief Medical Officer confirmed that the comments were specifically in reference to day six and seven tests and that government advice not to routinely test after …

fact_check_explanation_title: The Warm Home Discount is £140 for the entire winter, not a week
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Prime Minister described the discount incorrectly during PMQs.

fact_check_explanation_title: Unvaccinated people are among those dying of Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: Age adjusted mortality rates are higher for those who haven’t been vaccinated.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson did say inflation fears had been ‘unfounded’
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Prime Minister denied ever making the comment during the first PMQs of the year.

fact_check_explanation_title: Anna Soubry was wrong to say that the ‘overwhelming majority’ of Covid-19 patients are unvaccinated
fact_check_explanation_summary: The latest data at the time she was speaking showed that the unvaccinated made up 46% of admissions in England—although this might change when new data is published.

fact_check_explanation_title: Guardian didn’t deactivate ‘Person of the Year’ poll because J.K. Rowling took the lead
fact_check_explanation_summary: The request for reader nominations for their person of the year was not a poll and there’s no evidence it was deactivated because of the support for the Harry Potter …

fact_check_explanation_title: Tap water can’t test positive for Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: Using a lateral flow test incorrectly will produce unreliable and misleading results.

fact_check_explanation_title: How many Covid-19 patients in ICU are unvaccinated?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Recent data shows around half of those admitted in October and early November were unvaccinated—but this figure comes with important caveats

fact_check_explanation_title: Data likely overstates the number of house hunters per house
fact_check_explanation_summary: Data from estate agent membership organisation Propertymark estimates in November 2021 there were 29 buyers per house. This is probably too high.

fact_check_explanation_title: Priti Patel’s tweet on police funding doesn’t account for inflation
fact_check_explanation_summary: A graph claiming to show a large increase in police funding fails to take into account inflation.

fact_check_explanation_title: How many people in England are unvaccinated?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Depending on which population figure you use, the number of people unvaccinated in England could be 12.3 million or 19.5 million.

fact_check_explanation_title: Funeral director’s viral claims about vaccinated people not based in fact
fact_check_explanation_summary: He claims he’s seeing an unnaturally large number of heart attacks and clot-related deaths, but that’s not reflected in the national data.

fact_check_explanation_title: Iain Duncan Smith’s figures on school absence are out of date
fact_check_explanation_summary: The former Conservative leader claimed that more than 90,000 pupils are now absent from school.

fact_check_explanation_title: Daily Express is wrong to say most people would ignore a Christmas lockdown
fact_check_explanation_summary: This came from an online survey on the Express website, which means it does not represent the country as a whole.

fact_check_explanation_title: Evidence suggests myocarditis risk after Covid-19 vaccination is lower compared to Covid infection
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video posted on Facebook misleadingly suggests the risk of myocarditis is higher from a Covid-19 vaccine than from a Covid infection.

fact_check_explanation_title: Study linking gum disease and mental health shows correlation not causation
fact_check_explanation_summary: The study showing a link between poor mental health and gum disease did not make any claims about whether one caused the other, as suggested by the Telegraph.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Frank Lampard made these comments about Ronaldo and FIFA corruption
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post claims Frank Lampard made a number of inflammatory comments about footballing body FIFA.

fact_check_explanation_title: Brazil doesn’t produce 25% of the world’s food, as the UK’s trade envoy to the country claimed
fact_check_explanation_summary: UN data shows Brazil actually produces about 10% of the world’s food by weight and 4% by value.

fact_check_explanation_title: Why might vaccinated people account for a bigger share of Covid-19 deaths than infections?
fact_check_explanation_summary: In Scotland, vaccinated people account for a higher proportion of Covid-19 deaths than infections. This has led some to claim vaccines are making infections more severe.

fact_check_explanation_title: Actor pretended to have Covid-19 for hospital training exercise, not for propaganda
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post falsely claims to have proof of a ‘crisis actor’ pretending to be a Covid-19 hospital inpatient.

fact_check_explanation_title: UK booster roll out level twice the EU average
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Prime Minister made conflicting claims about the UK booster rollout versus Europe at PMQs and during a televised coronavirus update.

fact_check_explanation_title: The FDA recalls drugs for a wide range of reasons
fact_check_explanation_summary: They may be recalled for lots of reasons including labelling issues, concerns about manufacturing processes or contamination.

fact_check_explanation_title: What we know about the alleged Downing Street parties so far
fact_check_explanation_summary: From a timeline of events to a rundown of exactly what the rules were at the time.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson’s mum did not call him ‘an idiot with no common sense’
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post includes a made up quote from Boris Johnson’s mum saying she hoped he never went into politics.

fact_check_explanation_title: Reports Emma Tustin was hospitalised after inmates force fed her salt are not true
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post falsely claims Emma Tustin, who killed Arthur Labinjo-Hughes, has been hospitalised after being forced to eat 79 packets of salt.

fact_check_explanation_title: A post offering free TVs from Tesco is a scam
fact_check_explanation_summary: Tesco has told us that it does not come from its Facebook account, and it does not offer rewards for liking, sharing or commenting on posts.

fact_check_explanation_title: Argos is not offering microwaves for £1.78
fact_check_explanation_summary: Argos has told Full Fact that the Facebook post featuring the offer is not a legitimate post or page.

fact_check_explanation_title: Charles Bronson has not taken the father of Arthur Labinjo-Hughes hostage in prison
fact_check_explanation_summary: The two men are in different prisons.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video of monster climbing buildings appears to be a hoax
fact_check_explanation_summary: A graphic designer has said that he created one of the videos of the monster, and it unexpectedly went viral.

fact_check_explanation_title: What booster target has the government announced to tackle the Omicron variant?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The target is to give a booster dose of the Covid-19 vaccine to every eligible adult in England who wants one by the end of the year.

fact_check_explanation_title: Laws can be made without a parliamentary vote, contrary to the health secretary’s claim
fact_check_explanation_summary: New Covid face mask rules, for example, came into force before Parliament voted on the matter.

fact_check_explanation_title: There aren’t 10,000 patients in hospital with Covid in Wales
fact_check_explanation_summary: The latest data from the Welsh government suggests the correct figure is actually more like 500.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence asylum seekers have used pets to argue against deportation
fact_check_explanation_summary: A previously debunked claim about people being granted the right to live in the UK because they own a pet here has reappeared.

fact_check_explanation_title: Downing Street quiz picture doesn’t show bin bag over CCTV
fact_check_explanation_summary: Other photos of the room show it’s an ornate curtain.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video of Michael Gove dancing is from Conservative conference not Christmas party
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video of Michael Gove dancing to ‘I wanna dance with somebody’ is not from a Christmas party in Downing Street in 2020.

fact_check_explanation_title: Do police normally investigate things that happened a year ago?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Asked about an alleged party at Downing Street during lockdown, Dominic Raab claimed police ‘don’t normally’ investigate alleged offences which took place a year ago.

fact_check_explanation_title: Lionel Shriver is wrong to say that Covid-19 vaccines can’t stop the virus spreading
fact_check_explanation_summary: The vaccines prevent many infections from happening—and prevent many onward infections as a result.

fact_check_explanation_title: Lorraine Kelly and her guests were wrong about Covid-19 patients
fact_check_explanation_summary: The majority of people in hospital with Covid are vaccinated—but early reports suggest that the majority in intensive care are unvaccinated.

fact_check_explanation_title: Father of Arthur Labinjo-Hughes has not been attacked in prison
fact_check_explanation_summary: Thomas Hughes was recently jailed for 21 years over the killing of his son.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pfizer vaccine doesn’t have a 6% fatality rate
fact_check_explanation_summary: Data on adverse events following a Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine has been misrepresented to suggest one in 17 die.

fact_check_explanation_title: Why conspiracists are linking the Omicron variant to the Illuminati
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some dubious linguistics are being used to link the extinct secret society to the new Covid-19 variant.

fact_check_explanation_title: Flucloxacillin capsules contain iron oxide which may make them magnetic
fact_check_explanation_summary: The MHRA told Full Fact that iron oxide food colouring is frequently used in the shells of capsule medication.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook posts falsely advertise weight loss pills as endorsed by judges on US Dragons’ Den
fact_check_explanation_summary: Weight loss pills have never featured on the US show Shark Tank, where entrepreneurs pitch their products to investors.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson did receive his third Covid-19 vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: Multiple Facebook posts suggest, incorrectly, that Boris Johnson may not have received his Covid booster vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Catching Covid-19 is not less risky than vaccination
fact_check_explanation_summary: An Instagram post makes misleading claims about the Covid-19 survival rate and side effects from the vaccines.

fact_check_explanation_title: Express vastly overstates impact of UK trade deals
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Express suggested that post-Brexit trade deals will deliver a £766 billion boost. This figure refers to the total value of trade between the UK and countries it has agreed …

fact_check_explanation_title: No available evidence that vaccines caused teen deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post misleadingly suggests Covid-19 vaccines were responsible for the deaths of 10 teenagers

fact_check_explanation_title: Protecting others is a reason to wear a facemask
fact_check_explanation_summary: An important action of facemasks is their role in source control—reducing the number of particles released into the air by an infectious wearer.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video thanking Hungarian key workers doesn’t show pandemic is staged
fact_check_explanation_summary: Footage of a camera crew following three people in hazmat suits has been misinterpreted.

fact_check_explanation_title: Dissolved Omicron nanotechnology company has nothing to do with Covid-19 variant
fact_check_explanation_summary: The now-dissolved company was named after a Greek letter, like the new Covid-19 variant has been.

fact_check_explanation_title: Email asking people to pay for Omicron Covid-19 tests is a scam
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is no Omicron-specific PCR test and the NHS has confirmed the email is a scam.

fact_check_explanation_title: Picture of ‘giant mummy’ is a case of forced perspective
fact_check_explanation_summary: A picture shared on Facebook does not show a giant mummy found in America, but a normal sized mummy found in Tenerife.

fact_check_explanation_title: Figures in viral mask graphic aren’t substantiated
fact_check_explanation_summary: A graphic showing the risk of Covid-19 transmission between people wearing and not wearing masks contains figures which haven’t been evidenced.

fact_check_explanation_title: Resettlement figures don’t give us the full picture on refugee numbers
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s true that the UK has resettled the highest number of refugees since 2015, compared to other European countries.

fact_check_explanation_title: MPs cannot claim for alcohol from expenses
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post, which compares starting salaries of MPs and NHS staff, incorrectly suggests that MPs can claim alcohol from expenses.

fact_check_explanation_title: Dr Fauci did not ‘admit’ Covid-19 vaccines aren’t working
fact_check_explanation_summary: He said evidence shows immunity from vaccines decreases over time.

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s not ‘anti-science’ to wear a face mask
fact_check_explanation_summary: Masks have been shown to reduce the spread of droplets and are therefore thought to help prevent onward transmission.

fact_check_explanation_title: The facts about people seeking asylum in the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: The number of people applying for asylum in the UK looks to increase slightly this year, but the proportion who are arriving in boats across the Channel has increased significantly.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccines don’t cause ‘a form of AIDS’
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article online makes the false claim the Covid-19 vaccines cause AIDS.

fact_check_explanation_title: Concerns raised about legitimacy of research linking vaccines and heart attacks
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s been claimed new research shows a link between Covid-19 vaccines and heart attacks. The research has serious flaws.

fact_check_explanation_title: Misleading for Nadine Dorries to say Channel 4 is ‘in receipt of taxpayers’ money’
fact_check_explanation_summary: The broadcaster is publicly owned, but pays for itself through commercial operations. Its borrowing counts as public debt, but that doesn’t mean the taxpayer pays for it in the usual …

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaccine requirement law for NHS staff in England could be enforced regardless of contracts
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that pre-existing requirements need to be in your contract for the changes regarding vaccination of NHS staff to apply are ‘incorrect’ according to the DHSC.

fact_check_explanation_title: A ‘government consultation’ isn’t skewing data on lockdowns
fact_check_explanation_summary: An anti-lockdown group heavily criticised the survey, which was run by YouGov, not the UK government.

fact_check_explanation_title: Richard Madeley had his Covid-19 booster over a month before hospital visit
fact_check_explanation_summary: The presenter said he is now fine but was taken to hospital as a precaution.

fact_check_explanation_title: Children are more likely to die from Covid than vaccination
fact_check_explanation_summary: At least 25 children have sadly died from Covid in England alone, but we can find no evidence of a child dying as a result of the vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccines are recommended in pregnancy even after infection
fact_check_explanation_summary: Although infection may give some level of natural immunity, it is not clear how long this can last.

fact_check_explanation_title: Peston claim that immigration is top public concern based on his own findings
fact_check_explanation_summary: Most recent Ipsos Mori and YouGov polls don’t list this as the public’s number one concern.

fact_check_explanation_title: Numbers ‘in work’ not yet back to pre-pandemic levels
fact_check_explanation_summary: At PMQs the Prime Minister claimed the number of people in work had returned to pre-pandemic levels. This is true only for payrolled employees, not all workers.

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaccines don’t cause Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: There are various reasons why Covid case rates may be higher in countries with higher vaccination rates. It isn’t evidence vaccines cause Covid.

fact_check_explanation_title: Sharing picture of baby with rare heart condition will not raise money
fact_check_explanation_summary: The picture seems to be genuine but is over four years old.

fact_check_explanation_title: Dominic Raab didn’t say he watched Peppa Pig with his parents when he was young
fact_check_explanation_summary: Social media posts have incorrectly claimed the deputy prime minister said he watched Peppa Pig when he was young, even though it first aired when he was 30.

fact_check_explanation_title: The holes in face masks don’t mean they’re useless
fact_check_explanation_summary: Various studies have shown the effect of face masks on reducing the risk of viral infection.

fact_check_explanation_title: No-one was arrested for creating a labyrinth in Ikea using fake social distancing signs
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on social media about a man being arrested for creating a labyrinth in Ikea using ‘social distancing arrows’ was meant as a joke.

fact_check_explanation_title: ‘Vienna protest picture’ actually old photo of Moscow
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some are claiming a photo taken in Moscow in 1991 shows a protest in Vienna.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims about changes to Pfizer vaccine for children miss important details
fact_check_explanation_summary: A misleading article says a Covid-19 vaccine designed for children includes a solution used to stabilise heart attack patients.

fact_check_explanation_title: Hand gel safety alerts only apply to certain brands
fact_check_explanation_summary: The FDA in America has compiled a list of hand gels that contain dangerous ingredients, substandard ingredients, misleading labelling or unsafe packaging.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral ‘shark’ picture isn’t a shark at all
fact_check_explanation_summary: A picture of a goosefish isn’t a tasselled wobbegong, as one Twitter user claimed.

fact_check_explanation_title: The wife of the Pfizer CEO did not die from its vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: This story is a fabrication. Myriam Bourla is alive and well.

fact_check_explanation_title: WEF founder Klaus Schwab has not been arrested
fact_check_explanation_summary: Several online articles have claimed that the founder of the World Economic Forum was arrested by Swiss Police.

fact_check_explanation_title: Miscarriage does not occur in 90% of vaccinated pregnant women
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video from Dr Dolores Cahill and Dr Anne McCloskey includes a lot of false claims.

fact_check_explanation_title: Former MEP wrongly uses UK Covid-19 data
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video shared by former UKIP politician Godfrey Bloom makes a number of misleading claims about Covid-19 cases and vaccines.

fact_check_explanation_title: Test and Trace money didn’t all go to one company
fact_check_explanation_summary: The entire budget for the first year of Test and Trace was £22 billion, and the £13.5 billion spent went to a number of public and private organisations.

fact_check_explanation_title: QR scanners in Sainsbury’s are not for vaccine passes
fact_check_explanation_summary: New gates have been installed in a Holborn Sainsbury’s store as part of a checkout-free shopping trial.

fact_check_explanation_title: Unvaccinated people aren’t 32,000 times more likely to die from Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: An ONS report said the risk of death involving Covid-19 was 32 times greater in unvaccinated people than in fully vaccinated people from January to September 2021.

fact_check_explanation_title: Radio 4 programme featured Covid vaccine misinformation
fact_check_explanation_summary: A member of the public was allowed to share vaccine misinformation during a live broadcast.

fact_check_explanation_title: Study doesn’t show masks cause 53% drop in Covid risk
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Guardian and others claim mask-wearing cuts the risk of Covid by 53%.

fact_check_explanation_title: Research does not show 80% of vaccinated pregnant women experienced miscarriage
fact_check_explanation_summary: False claims that more than 80% experienced miscarriage after a Covid-19 vaccination are based on an error in a journal article that has since been withdrawn.

fact_check_explanation_title: Health doesn’t account for 40% of day-to-day public spending
fact_check_explanation_summary: Health accounts for around 20% of day-to-day public spending, not 40%.

fact_check_explanation_title: Study doesn’t show tea and coffee cause lower dementia and stroke risk
fact_check_explanation_summary: A study which has shown a possible link between drinking tea and coffee and reduced risk of strokes and dementia does not determine that this is definitely the cause. The …

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid vaccines have not caused four times as many deaths as all other vaccines combined
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article by The Exposé incorrectly claims that there have been over four times as many deaths due to Covid vaccines in 10 months as due to all other vaccines …

fact_check_explanation_title: Japan is not using ivermectin instead of vaccines to treat Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: The false claim has spread on social media, after appearing on the website of the Hal Turner Radio Show

fact_check_explanation_title: What are the risks of Covid-19 in pregnancy?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Evidence so far shows that you are not more likely to be infected with Covid-19 in pregnancy, but you are at risk of more severe disease if you do catch …

fact_check_explanation_title: Hunt for child who told man ‘you’re not my dad’ was false alarm
fact_check_explanation_summary: Police have called off the search—but two newspapers only updated their websites to reflect this after Full Fact contacted them.

fact_check_explanation_title: Old photo of bed attached to bicycle is not the world’s first ambulance service
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post incorrectly claims a photo from 1941 depicts the world’s first ambulance service.

fact_check_explanation_title: Scotland’s electricity consumption isn’t 100% renewable
fact_check_explanation_summary: Scotland produces renewable electricity equivalent to its annual consumption, but some of this is exported. In 2020, 56% of the electricity consumed in Scotland came from renewable sources.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Zoflora cleaner harms fertility
fact_check_explanation_summary: If used according to the manufacturer’s instructions, the product is safe.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook is not suddenly sharing private posts
fact_check_explanation_summary: This an old rumour that has been spread many times before.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence GPS ‘smart dust’ is being implanted in humans
fact_check_explanation_summary: In 2006 Hitachi announced the world’s smallest radio frequency identification, known as “smart dust”.

fact_check_explanation_title: SARS-CoV-2 does exist
fact_check_explanation_summary: It has now been sequenced over a million times in the UK.

fact_check_explanation_title: This picture of a bus warning about childhood strokes wasn’t taken in the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: The picture is from a campaign by a Canadian charity raising awareness about strokes in children.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla has not been arrested for vaccine data fraud
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s no evidence this happened—Pfizer says the claim is false and he was not arrested.

fact_check_explanation_title: You can’t recharge an electric car by attaching a generator to the wheel
fact_check_explanation_summary: The reason no one has manufactured a self-charging electric car is it would break the laws of physics.

fact_check_explanation_title: Photo of smiley face in forest is real
fact_check_explanation_summary: A photo of an orange smiley face in the middle of a forest was deliberately planted by a timber company.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook offer to buy a Dyson hair dryer for £1.78 is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on social media falsely claims that Currys is selling Dyson hair dryers for £1.78.

fact_check_explanation_title: Molnupiravir and ivermectin are not the same
fact_check_explanation_summary: Both drugs are produced by Merck, but that doesn’t mean that they are the same.

fact_check_explanation_title: Be wary of claims Covid-19 deaths “soar” on Tuesdays
fact_check_explanation_summary: Reporting delays mean that the headline figure for Covid-19 deaths is always high on Tuesdays—and low on Sundays and Mondays.

fact_check_explanation_title: Brexit hasn’t quadrupled the cost of fuel for fishing boats
fact_check_explanation_summary: An old social media post, which is being shared again, claims that Brexit would cause the cost of fuel used by fishing boats to more than quadruple. This is not …

fact_check_explanation_title: Italy hasn’t changed its Covid-19 death toll from 130,000 to under 4,000
fact_check_explanation_summary: Contrary to various online claims, the Italian health authority has done nothing of the sort.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence people are trying to kill with fentanyl-laced tape on cars
fact_check_explanation_summary: Even if they were, touching ‘contaminated’ tape wouldn’t be fatal.

fact_check_explanation_title: Study linking sleep time and heart disease risk shows correlation not causation
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Mail reported that a new study shows going to bed between 10pm and 11pm cuts your risk of heart disease. The study found a link between the two but …

fact_check_explanation_title: Emissions from COP26 private jets are far, far lower than Scotland’s annual CO2 output
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims on Twitter seriously misunderstand a headline which equates private jet emissions to the emissions of just 1,600 Scots.

fact_check_explanation_title: Police have not said a West Midlands teen was "murdered" with a Covid-19 vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video on Facebook wrongly claims police have “agreed” that a teenager was killed with a Covid-19 vaccine

fact_check_explanation_title: Parents aren’t being urged to donate their children’s organs at vaccine appointments
fact_check_explanation_summary: A manipulated image has been shared thousands of times online.

fact_check_explanation_title: Poll didn’t indicate the majority want a new Covid-19 lockdown
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is no indication that the poll, carried out amongst Independent readers, included a representative sample of respondents.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 hospitalisations are below last year, not 14 times higher as NHS CEO claimed
fact_check_explanation_summary: NHS England CEO Amanda Pritchard claimed the number of people with Covid-19 in hospitals is 14x higher than last year. She was comparing data from August 2021 and August 2020.

fact_check_explanation_title: Parliament’s food outlets ran at a loss of £9 million in 2020/21
fact_check_explanation_summary: Catering services in the Houses of Parliament run at a loss.

fact_check_explanation_title: Picture of parked up private jets isn’t from COP26
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some are claiming a 2013 picture likely taken during the Super Bowl in New Orleans, was taken in Glasgow during the climate change conference.

fact_check_explanation_title: Why are media outlets reporting the Covid epidemic is escalating?
fact_check_explanation_summary: In recent days, CNN and Sky News have claimed the epidemic is growing, despite falling daily case numbers.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pregnancy, vaccination and going to work - what does the guidance say?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Readers have asked us what the guidance says on going into work while pregnant, and what employers need to do to ensure safety.

fact_check_explanation_title: How the UK Health Security Agency’s misleading data fuelled a global vaccine myth
fact_check_explanation_summary: We reveal how one confusing table about “case rates” has been shared globally and ended up in the hands of Jair Bolsonaro, who linked the Covid-19 vaccines with AIDS.

fact_check_explanation_title: Guardian wrong to suggest unvaccinated deaths are the majority currently
fact_check_explanation_summary: UKHSA explains that this is because a larger proportion of the population are vaccinated than unvaccinated.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence linking deaths among children to vaccine rollout
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article by The Exposé makes a misleading link between official statistics on child deaths and Covid-19 vaccines.

fact_check_explanation_title: Day of the Dead drone display of skull wearing sombrero didn’t happen
fact_check_explanation_summary: A photo of what looks like a colourful drone display depicting a skull wearing a sombrero for the Mexican Day of the Dead isn’t real.

fact_check_explanation_title: Joe Rogan podcast uses Covid-19 death data out of context
fact_check_explanation_summary: The UKHSA explained these figures are to be expected, because a larger proportion of the population are vaccinated than unvaccinated.

fact_check_explanation_title: BBC presenter corrects false claim about Owen Paterson vote
fact_check_explanation_summary: BBC Breakfast presenter Charlie Stayt claimed a vote on whether to suspend Owen Paterson for breaches of the MPs Code of Conduct was a ‘free vote’. It wasn’t. It was …

fact_check_explanation_title: Did the French PM really ask for the EU to ‘punish’ the UK over Brexit?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims the French PM wrote to the EU President asking the EU to punish the UK for Brexit have been controversial. We look at what his letter actually said.

fact_check_explanation_title: 293 ‘daily’ Covid deaths likely cover more than one day after technical issue
fact_check_explanation_summary: 293 Covid-19 deaths were reported on 2 November, in part because a technical issue meant death recording was delayed over the weekend.

fact_check_explanation_title: Morrisons chicken sparks backlash
fact_check_explanation_summary: A picture of a chicken from Morrisons has gone viral for packaging stating the salt and pepper used are “non-EU”. Morrisons says this is to comply with legal requirements, not …

fact_check_explanation_title: Spiking: Very rare to contract HIV through used needle
fact_check_explanation_summary: The National AIDS Trust said some posts claiming victims of needle spiking had tested positive for HIV were “demonstrably false”.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccines do offer some protection against transmission and infection
fact_check_explanation_summary: Neil Oliver recently incorrectly said that Covid-19 vaccines don’t offer any protection against transmission or infection from the virus.

fact_check_explanation_title: Was the Chancellor right on the Budget increasing departmental spending by the most this century?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Chancellor announced departmental spending during this Parliament would increase by the largest amount this century. Our calculations show spending increased more each year from 2001-2005.

fact_check_explanation_title: What do we know so far about reports of ‘spiking’ with needles?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Police across the UK are investigating more than 50 reports of incidents involving some form of injection.

fact_check_explanation_title: Why can you mix and match booster jabs in pregnancy?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists are encouraging pregnant women to get the booster.

fact_check_explanation_title: False claims from funeral director about facemasks, vaccines and the pandemic
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely shared video on social media, featuring an interview with a funeral director contains false information about the Covid-19 pandemic.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims of an EU mineral water ban need a drop of context
fact_check_explanation_summary: Manufacturers can continue to export to Britain, as long as they renew their accreditation by 7 January 2022.

fact_check_explanation_title: Murky claims about sewage bill fact checked
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims the government voted for sewage to be pumped into rivers, and that a rejected amendment would have cost taxpayers hundreds of billions of pounds need clarification.

fact_check_explanation_title: There are no parasites in the Covid-19 vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that the vaccines contain a parasite normally found in fish eggs are completely untrue.

fact_check_explanation_title: Is the UK really the EU’s ‘Treasure Island’?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The UK accounts for 69% of the EU’s goods trade surplus—but that’s a figure which could be misleading unless you understand exactly how it’s calculated.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fake photo of William Shatner does not prove he didn’t go into space
fact_check_explanation_summary: A photo of William Shatner circulating on Facebook is digitally manipulated - but it isn’t proof the Blue Origin space launch was faked.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral tweet on Rishi Sunak’s tax claims got it wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: The tweet misunderstood what the Chancellor said.

fact_check_explanation_title: Photo of lorry stuck in Bristol harbour used to spread misinformation about HGV tests
fact_check_explanation_summary: A photo of a lorry stuck in Bristol harbour has been used to, wrongly, claim that HGV drivers won’t be tested on reversing.

fact_check_explanation_title: Observer Twitter poll data on air monitors is meaningless
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Observer has reported that only 8% of schools have received CO2 monitors, based on a meaningless Twitter poll.

fact_check_explanation_title: Don’t believe the funny story about the navy and the lighthouse
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s a famous myth that is now decades old.

fact_check_explanation_title: Sweden is not abolishing cash
fact_check_explanation_summary: The use of coins and banknotes is declining, but the government and the central bank have no plans to stop issuing them.

fact_check_explanation_title: Government hasn’t explained differing statements on lab accused of  inaccurate Covid-19 results
fact_check_explanation_summary: The government has changed its statement about the lab in question, but has not explained the discrepancy or why inaccurate information was originally released.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 can be fatal and tests for it aren’t rigged
fact_check_explanation_summary: According to the ONS there have been over 128,000 deaths with Covid-19 listed as the underlying cause in England and Wales since March 2020.

fact_check_explanation_title: Photo of diesel-powered electric vehicle charging point is at least two years old
fact_check_explanation_summary: An image of a diesel-powered electric vehicle charging point dates back to at least 2019 and there’s no evidence it shows a charging point in Lancashire as claimed.

fact_check_explanation_title: Most people admitted to hospital with Covid-19 are vaccinated
fact_check_explanation_summary: The vaccines are not perfect, and the vast majority of vulnerable people have been vaccinated, so the small proportion who get seriously ill still amount to a lot of people.

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaccinated pilot did not die mid-flight
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post repeats a widely debunked claim that a pilot working for a US airline died during a flight.

fact_check_explanation_title: NHS Covid-19 app is not the third most expensive project ever
fact_check_explanation_summary: The total NHS Test and Trace budget for two years has been misused.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post claiming to show Palestinian girl who grew up to be a lecturer not what it seems
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post claims to show a picture of a Palestinian girl in 2003 who grew up to be a lecturer in Canada. But the people in the photographs are …

fact_check_explanation_title: Churchill street sweeper quote has been attributed to many politicians
fact_check_explanation_summary: The format of the anecdote, seen thousands of times on Facebook, is almost identical to false posts about other successful couples.

fact_check_explanation_title: Official LEGO donation service not yet available in UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post incorrectly suggests that you can donate LEGO to the company’s official charity scheme, currently only available in the US and Canada.

fact_check_explanation_title: Picture of refugees on ship isn’t from WWII
fact_check_explanation_summary: A picture on Facebook misidentifies a 1991 picture as one taken during the Second World War.

fact_check_explanation_title: A photo of a tiny bird actually shows a tiny sculpture
fact_check_explanation_summary: The smallest bird in the world is the bee hummingbird, which is roughly twice as big as the model in the photo.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fireworks are not banned in London on New Year’s Eve
fact_check_explanation_summary: Although the official Thames fireworks are not happening this year, Londoners can set off fireworks until the 1am curfew as usual.

fact_check_explanation_title: Canada is not implementing a social credit scheme
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post falsely claims a scheme that monitors the actions of businesses and citizens and uses financial sanctions as punishments will soon be used in Canada.

fact_check_explanation_title: Two doctors with same name cause Times letter confusion
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post incorrectly claims that a letter written to The Times was from a doctor who died in 2016.

fact_check_explanation_title: About 3.6% of men have recently experienced domestic abuse
fact_check_explanation_summary: It is not around 7%, as the Safeguarding Minister claimed. This is the figure for women.

fact_check_explanation_title: England hasn’t ‘kept’ £450 billion of Scottish taxes since 2001
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post claiming England has kept Scottish taxes ignores the money spent by the UK government for or in Scotland.

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaccine rap battle full of misinformation
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video on Facebook shares several common types of harmful misinformation about Covid-19 and the vaccines.

fact_check_explanation_title: Bill Gates’ £400m claim about green investment was wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: The entrepreneur said both his organisation and the UK government were contributing £400 million each to a new fund.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral tweet overstates UK’s lead in Covid-19 cases
fact_check_explanation_summary: There are things to take into account when you see UK data compared with other countries.

fact_check_explanation_title: Concerns about animal welfare are just one reason Sainsbury’s stopped selling fireworks
fact_check_explanation_summary: A spokesperson for the supermarket giant told us it hadn’t sold fireworks since 2019.

fact_check_explanation_title: NHSX website doesn’t reveal vaccine passport roll out
fact_check_explanation_summary: The government confirmed that proving vaccination status continues to be an option, rather than a definite plan for December.

fact_check_explanation_title: NASA didn’t paste a picture of the Earth into photos from the moon
fact_check_explanation_summary: An Instagram video makes a number of bizarre claims about NASA manipulating footage from space and its Apollo programme.

fact_check_explanation_title: Nigel Farage understates renewable energy generation
fact_check_explanation_summary: Nigel Farage claimed renewables produced just 2-3% of the country’s electricity for three weeks in September. But it was 10%-19% each day and has since increased.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Tesco is sacking 4,300 workers
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post claims 4,300 Tesco workers are getting sacked and this is why you shouldn’t use self checkout machines.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Joe Rogan podcast misused English Covid-19 data
fact_check_explanation_summary: A guest misused a PHE report, which does not show that vaccinated people are more likely to catch the disease

fact_check_explanation_title: The Covid-19 virus has been isolated many times in Spain—and elsewhere
fact_check_explanation_summary: The fact that the Spanish Ministry of Health doesn’t have its own viral cultures doesn’t mean it thinks they don’t exist.

fact_check_explanation_title: Can those undergoing fertility treatment have the Covid-19 vaccine?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The RCOG and British Fertility Society both say those undergoing treatment can have the vaccine, and experts say there’s no evidence it affects fertility

fact_check_explanation_title: There is no HIV in the Covid-19 vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video on Instagram includes many false claims about Covid-19 vaccines including that they contain HIV.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Covid-19 vaccines do protect against severe disease
fact_check_explanation_summary: There are more vaccinated people in hospital with Covid because the vast majority of vulnerable people have now been vaccinated.

fact_check_explanation_title: Emergency services can’t use the numbers on street lamps to find you
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post wrongly suggests that numbering on street lamps will let emergency services know exactly where you are.

fact_check_explanation_title: Study doesn’t prove that statins ‘cut’ the risk of dying from Covid
fact_check_explanation_summary: A headline in the Daily Express was wrong to say that statins actually caused a lower death rate among people taking them.

fact_check_explanation_title: World leaders will not get Tesla cars at COP26
fact_check_explanation_summary: Jaguar Land Rover electric cars will be supplied, and any generators required for charging them will be run on recycled cooking oil.

fact_check_explanation_title: Social media post appears to overstate risk of vaccine blood clots
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post implies the risk of developing a blood clot or heart problem from a Covid-19 vaccine outweighs the benefits.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccines still don’t contain graphene oxide
fact_check_explanation_summary: The claim has been going round since a Spanish professor got a vial of what claimed to be Pfizer vaccine in the post, and said it looked like graphene oxide …

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence you shouldn’t breastfeed after Covid-19 vaccination
fact_check_explanation_summary: An Instagram post takes a tragic story of an infant’s death and uses it to make baseless claims about vaccine safety.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral image doesn’t show an elephant fish
fact_check_explanation_summary: An image being widely shared on social media looks decidedly different from recognised species of elephant fish.

fact_check_explanation_title: A ‘Guardian’ headline about the Insulate Britain protests is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: The newspaper did not report that a protester was delayed in traffic caused by another Insulate Britain protest.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fungi growing ‘out of’ dead possum’s hand is staged
fact_check_explanation_summary: This type of fungi does grow around decaying carcasses but the photographer says he staged the picture.

fact_check_explanation_title: An Australian professor didn’t say Covid-19 vaccines aren’t vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: She actually said the Covid-19 vaccines aren’t live vaccines.

fact_check_explanation_title: No, the ‘P’ on your passport does not stand for ‘peasant’
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post falsely claims that the capital ‘P’ which appears on passports under “type” stands for “peasants”.

fact_check_explanation_title: Daily Mail report on GPs seeing fewer patients on Fridays needs more context
fact_check_explanation_summary: There are some important caveats to figures showing GP appointments drop off later in the week.

fact_check_explanation_title: MailOnline muddles professorship ethnicity figures
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Royal Society found that 3.5% of black academic staff working in STEM were professors, not that 3.5% of professors were black.

fact_check_explanation_title: Thousands of sea turtles did not hatch on Indian beach this week
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post falsely suggests that hundreds of thousands of sea turtles hatched at a beach in India.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence New South Wales Premier resigned over bribes from Pfizer or AstraZeneca
fact_check_explanation_summary: While Australian politician Gladys Berejiklian has resigned recently it has nothing to do with vaccinations.

fact_check_explanation_title: mRNA vaccines aren’t gene editing and don’t alter your DNA
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video claiming vaccines are part of the ‘fourth industrial revolution’ uses footage of World Economic Forum founder Klaus Schwab to claim vaccines edit your genes.

fact_check_explanation_title: You can still park on the pavement in Wales
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Welsh government is planning to give councils more power to fine problem parkers from July next year, but doesn’t plan to pursue an outright ban.

fact_check_explanation_title: Teen deaths up since last year, but no evidence vaccines responsible
fact_check_explanation_summary: 2020 saw lower than average teen deaths due to various factors, and so isn’t a “normal” year to compare 2021 against.

fact_check_explanation_title: What do we know about the AstraZeneca vaccine in pregnancy?
fact_check_explanation_summary: We’ve answered some of your most frequently asked questions.

fact_check_explanation_title: Most police have not been found guilty of sexual misconduct
fact_check_explanation_summary: This claim comes from confusion over another statistic, about the proportion of those in one force found to have committed sexual misconduct who kept their jobs.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson claim about HGV driver visas sparks confusion
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Prime Minister told a BBC journalist that 127 HGV drivers had applied for short-term visas. But the government’s bizarrely refused to explain how that figure is calculated.

fact_check_explanation_title: Falling crime is related to pandemic lockdowns
fact_check_explanation_summary: Boris Johnson said falls in police recorded crime are ‘not just’ because of lockdowns.

fact_check_explanation_title: How much do firefighters, paramedics and police officers earn?
fact_check_explanation_summary: An old viral post with almost 50,000 shares is now out of date.

fact_check_explanation_title: Angela Rayner wrong on wage growth
fact_check_explanation_summary: Labour’s deputy leader claimed the average worker is £1,000 a year worse off now than in 2010 but this is compared to 2020, not 2021.

fact_check_explanation_title: Amazon parcels do not pose widespread risk to cats
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post falsely claims that all Amazon packaging is covered in toxic pesticides harmful to cats.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claim that up to 135,000 children have not returned to school needs more context
fact_check_explanation_summary: Figures supposedly showing that between 95,000 and 135,000 children failed to return to school this term are based on a snapshot of just one day.

fact_check_explanation_title: Nebulised hydrogen peroxide shouldn’t be used to treat all respiratory illnesses
fact_check_explanation_summary: The MHRA told Full Fact that it has ‘significant concerns that this practice is not safe’.

fact_check_explanation_title: Marr wrong to claim PM wasn’t telling the truth on wages
fact_check_explanation_summary: Wages are not up over the past quarter, but they are up over the past year.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Charles Bronson attacked Wayne Couzens in jail
fact_check_explanation_summary: Charles Bronson is in HMP Woodhill and Wayne Couzens is likely still at Belmarsh.

fact_check_explanation_title: What is the advice on getting the Pfizer vaccine during pregnancy?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The JCVI has advised that pregnant women should be vaccinated at the same time as the rest of their age or risk group.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Jodie Foster said that attacking the rich was ‘self-defence’
fact_check_explanation_summary: The real source of this comment is uncertain, but it may have originated on Twitter in 2014.

fact_check_explanation_title: Chemical used to sterilise Covid-19 tests won’t turn into deadly antifreeze
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video incorrectly suggests a gas used to sterilise lateral flow tests can cause cancer and its use is being hidden from the public.

fact_check_explanation_title: The role of antiperspirant in causing breast cancer is not proven
fact_check_explanation_summary: Cancer Research UK says there’s no convincing evidence behind this.

fact_check_explanation_title: CDC has not said SARS-CoV-2 has never been isolated
fact_check_explanation_summary: This is a misunderstanding of a passage of a CDC document.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence government spreading fuel shortage rumours to sell surplus
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s been claimed the government spread fuel shortage lies to sell a surplus which was about to expire. There is no evidence of this.

fact_check_explanation_title: How many more HGV drivers does the UK need?
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s been claimed that the UK is short 100,000 HGV drivers, but the government has reportedly said we only need another 30,000.

fact_check_explanation_title: Woman filling bags with petrol was not filmed in south London
fact_check_explanation_summary: A tweet falsely claims that a woman was filmed filling plastic bags full of petrol at an Esso forecourt in Tooting.

fact_check_explanation_title: We do know that Covid-19 vaccines work
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video of Bill Gates saying we don’t know whether vaccines work comes from July 2020, when the results of the Covid-19 vaccine trials had not yet been published.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ethylene oxide-sterilised swabs won’t cause harm during pregnancy
fact_check_explanation_summary: A PHE document on ethylene oxide exposure is not talking about the limited exposure you get from using sterilised swabs, which are extremely unlikely to have any of the chemical …

fact_check_explanation_title: Chevening isn’t 'taxpayer-funded' in the usual sense
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s paid for by a public trust—but that trust is exempt from income tax and appears to have received at least some taxpayer money in the past.

fact_check_explanation_title: Red Cross hasn’t banned blood donation from vaccinated people
fact_check_explanation_summary: The American Red Cross has stopped taking donations of blood plasma containing antibodies as it has enough supply.

fact_check_explanation_title: Citric acid is not being used by ‘evil forces’ to harm population
fact_check_explanation_summary: Manufactured citric acid is one of the most common food additives in the world.

fact_check_explanation_title: Has Brexit caused higher gas prices?
fact_check_explanation_summary: There are a number of factors at play but leaving the Internal Energy Market is unlikely to be a significant one.

fact_check_explanation_title: Figures about Pfizer side effects for children need more context
fact_check_explanation_summary: 86% of 12 to 15 year-olds reported a sore arm after vaccination.

fact_check_explanation_title: Not all bumblebees are endangered
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post wrongly suggests that all bumblebees are endangered.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pregnancy tests can’t reliably diagnose testicular cancer
fact_check_explanation_summary: Over-the-counter pregnancy tests detect high levels of a hormone sometimes associated with testicular cancer, but this doesn’t mean they can be used to identify the disease.

fact_check_explanation_title: Casting call for ‘hospital patients’ was for NHS recruitment advert
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some have claimed a search for extras shows something fishy is going on.

fact_check_explanation_title: MP makes unevidenced claims about vaccine damage
fact_check_explanation_summary: Christopher Chope presented a number of misleading or unevidenced statements about Covid-19 vaccines to the House of Commons.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid vaccines aren’t comparable to thalidomide scandal
fact_check_explanation_summary: An Instagram post which compares the rollout of Covid vaccines with the thalidomide scandal, ignores the context and history these medicines exist in.

fact_check_explanation_title: A video does not show anti-Rothschild protests
fact_check_explanation_summary: It shows a demonstration against pandemic rules outside the parliament building in Bern, Switzerland.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pre-eclampsia doesn’t only occur 26 to 32 weeks into pregnancy
fact_check_explanation_summary: This timing refers to the recruitment criteria for a particular study looking at pre-eclampsia.
