fact_check_explanation_title: Children should still follow Covid-19 rules after vaccination
fact_check_explanation_summary: An ‘easy read’ version of a Covid-19 vaccine consent form for children and young people was wrong to say you could ignore the rules when vaccinated.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Covid-19 vaccine makes blood look different
fact_check_explanation_summary: A picture of two donations of blood claims they come from unvaccinated and vaccinated donors.

fact_check_explanation_title: Do pregnant women get Covid-19 booster vaccines?
fact_check_explanation_summary: RCOG have advised that pregnant women receive the booster vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Electrolysis video doesn’t prove tap water is dangerous
fact_check_explanation_summary: Tap water in the UK is tested often, and this device doesn’t prove there’s anything wrong with it.

fact_check_explanation_title: ‘Scary’ Mickey Mouse picture wasn’t taken at 1940s Disney World
fact_check_explanation_summary: Walt Disney didn’t open his first theme park until 1955.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pfizer’s new trial drug is not ivermectin in disguise
fact_check_explanation_summary: They are very different compounds.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccines passed animal trials
fact_check_explanation_summary: All four vaccines approved for use in the UK have passed animal trials.

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaccines do not raise your risk of catching Covid
fact_check_explanation_summary: The headline of a Daily Sceptic article misinterpreted the data in a PHE report— even though the report specifically warned against this.

fact_check_explanation_title: Universal Credit: Do politicians' claims about working more hours add up?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Conservatives and Labour gave very different figures for how much longer claimants would have to work to offset the end of the £20 uplift

fact_check_explanation_title: PCR tests have not been revoked by the FDA
fact_check_explanation_summary: The FDA recalled one brand of lateral flow tests earlier this year, but claims that PCR tests have been revoked by the agency are untrue.

fact_check_explanation_title: What do we know about the Covid-19 vaccines crossing the placenta?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The vaccines are recommended for pregnant women.

fact_check_explanation_title: Scottish taxes don’t subsidise English spending
fact_check_explanation_summary: Public spending per person in Scotland is higher than across the UK as a whole, and higher than the revenue raised in Scotland.

fact_check_explanation_title: CCTV showing woman’s drink being spiked is a dramatisation
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video on social media which shows a woman’s drink being spiked was staged for ‘entertainment purposes’.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 is almost certainly killing more people than suicide
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post that suicide deaths are higher provides no evidence. And what evidence we have suggests the opposite.

fact_check_explanation_title: Posts claiming ‘every share earns money’ for sick children tend to be fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: An image from 2017 of a girl with leukemia is going viral, but she isn’t getting a $1 donation per share.

fact_check_explanation_title: Poster claiming bread is healthy for ducks gets its facts in a flap
fact_check_explanation_summary: Bread is healthy in small amounts but should form part of a wider diet, according to charities and experts.

fact_check_explanation_title: World Trade Center 7 didn’t collapse for ‘no apparent reason'
fact_check_explanation_summary: A nearby building did collapse on 9/11 despite not being hit by a plane, due to a complex process of structural failures caused by fire.

fact_check_explanation_title: Quote about love does not appear to come from Frida Kahlo
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post shares a quote about love which is attributed to Frida Kahlo. Full Fact can’t find any evidence that she said this.

fact_check_explanation_title: There are ways to identify the Delta variant
fact_check_explanation_summary: It is done through further analysis of positive PCR results.

fact_check_explanation_title: Can you have a shorter gap between Covid-19 vaccines in pregnancy?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The official guidance says the main exception to the eight week interval minimum is those about to start immunosuppressant treatment.

fact_check_explanation_title: Newspapers report Covid hospitalisations over seven months as over seven days
fact_check_explanation_summary: In the seven months to 29 August, 9,472 people in England stayed in hospital overnight with a confirmed case of the Delta variant.

fact_check_explanation_title: Instagram isn’t blocking posts to your followers
fact_check_explanation_summary: A number of social media posts falsely claim Instagram limits the number of posts seen by others.

fact_check_explanation_title: Reversing is not being removed from HGV driving tests
fact_check_explanation_summary: This is a misinterpretation of a government plan to let approved third parties assess the reversing portion of the test.

fact_check_explanation_title: The government did not give £37 billion to Serco
fact_check_explanation_summary: This is the total budget for two years of Test and Trace. Not all of it was spent, and only a fraction went to Serco.

fact_check_explanation_title: Evidence so far does not show the Mu variant is ‘immune to vaccines’
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Covid-19 strain is currently designated a variant of interest and has a number of potentially concerning mutations.

fact_check_explanation_title: Error in BBC reporting doesn’t mean 9/11 was scripted
fact_check_explanation_summary: Conspiracy theories about World Trade Center 7 have flourished since the attack.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fact checked: six key claims about the new health and social care plan
fact_check_explanation_summary: It was announced on Tuesday that National Insurance would be raised to help pay for the government’s new health and social care plan.

fact_check_explanation_title: New figures on healthcare workers' suicides should be treated with caution
fact_check_explanation_summary: Most of the suicides registered in the first half of 2020 occurred in previous years.

fact_check_explanation_title: No, health won’t account for 40% of all public spending
fact_check_explanation_summary: Health will account for around 40% of the day-to-day spending that can be budgeted by departments, which itself only accounts for about half of government spending.

fact_check_explanation_title: An influencer muddled his maths on vaccines for children
fact_check_explanation_summary: The JCVI says that the Covid vaccines would probably do marginally more good than harm, even for healthy children.

fact_check_explanation_title: What do we know about the long-term effects of Covid-19 vaccines in pregnancy?
fact_check_explanation_summary: We don’t have long-term data on the use of the vaccines in pregnancy, but our knowledge is growing, and the evidence we do have so far is reassuring.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral video makes incorrect claims about teenagers and vaccine consent
fact_check_explanation_summary: A 2020 court case, known as Bell vs Tavistock, doesn’t mean it’s illegal to vaccinate teenagers without parental consent or a court order

fact_check_explanation_title: What we know about the Taliban and Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post claims the Taliban took over Afghanistan with no vaccines, masks or mass deaths amongst their population. This seems unlikely from what we know about the country at …

fact_check_explanation_title: WD-40 did not say it “makes screwing a pleasure”
fact_check_explanation_summary: This is a fake ad created as a joke. It gets the name of its own product wrong, for starters.

fact_check_explanation_title: 9/11 video doesn’t prove plane didn’t hit South Tower
fact_check_explanation_summary: The post shows the moment Flight 175 struck the South Tower of the World Trade Center.

fact_check_explanation_title: HGV securing point rules aren’t changing
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post cites the defunct government agency VOSA.

fact_check_explanation_title: What the National Insurance rise means for the tax burden
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s been claimed the NI rise will take the tax burden to the highest level “in history”, in peacetime, since 1948, since 1950 and since 1969.

fact_check_explanation_title: ‘Free Morrisons food box’ offer is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Facebook claims that people can receive a free food box in exchange for comments and shares.

fact_check_explanation_title: Scottish Water says there’s no radium in its drinking water
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral Facebook post claims a Scottish Water worker was overheard saying radium in the water is making people sick.

fact_check_explanation_title: A survey of diversity in children’s books is flawed
fact_check_explanation_summary: A BBC News article said 10% of children’s books have an ethnic minority character, but this figure comes from flawed research.

fact_check_explanation_title: Data doesn’t show parents will ‘insist’ on children wearing masks to school
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Mail Online article incorrectly claims ‘23% of parents of secondary pupils will insist their children wear masks’.

fact_check_explanation_title: Germany has not stopped using Covid-19 vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post falsely claims Germany’s government no longer recommends Covid-19 vaccination.

fact_check_explanation_title: How soon after childbirth can you have a Covid-19 vaccine?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Guidance says you can have a Covid-19 vaccine anytime during pregnancy or after birth.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence one million people legally moved to Britain in 2020/2021
fact_check_explanation_summary: Turning Point UK’s claims are based on assumptions that are not supported by the official data.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video falsely claims that you cannot refuse the Covid-19 vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: We fact check this, and several other claims.

fact_check_explanation_title: Daily Mail understates the risks of Covid-19 to children
fact_check_explanation_summary: Severe disease and death are very rare, but still more common than the Mail claimed.

fact_check_explanation_title: There are far fewer than 850,000 registered sex offenders in the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Freedom of Information request showed there are almost 100,000 people on the sex offenders register in England and Wales.

fact_check_explanation_title: The mayor of Calgary didn't say that Covid-19 was a hoax
fact_check_explanation_summary: This comes from what seems to be a fake transcript of a court hearing that never happened.

fact_check_explanation_title: Immunity through Covid infection is much riskier than a vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: Getting vaccinated is still effective, and far safer, whether you’ve had the disease or not.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence the Queen ordered 80 Manchester United shirts
fact_check_explanation_summary: Or asked for Cristiano Ronaldo’s signature, for that matter.

fact_check_explanation_title: Deaths from vaccines have not overtaken Covid-19 deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: A TCW article misuses data about Covid-19 deaths and deaths after vaccinations to make false claims about vaccine safety.

fact_check_explanation_title: Wetherspoons Covid-19 reopening deal is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post falsely claims Wetherspoons is offering a meal and drinks voucher to celebrate pubs fully reopening after lockdown.

fact_check_explanation_title: No plans to release Charles Bronson in December
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Ministry of Justice spokesperson confirmed claims on social media were inaccurate.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video of ‘QR code’ detected in arm is not evidence of vaccine microchips
fact_check_explanation_summary: There are no microchips in Covid-19 vaccines.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Kabul airport video is faked
fact_check_explanation_summary: The fact people are not being blown over is no evidence the footage is faked, as suggested.

fact_check_explanation_title: NHS Test and Trace has not spent as much as war in Afghanistan yet
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post wrongly claims UK involvement in Afghanistan cost 59% of NHS Test and Trace

fact_check_explanation_title: Breastfeeding after Covid-19 vaccine is recommended as safe
fact_check_explanation_summary: The NHS says you cannot catch Covid-19 from the vaccines or pass it on to your baby through breast milk.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post makes incorrect claims about TV licence fee non-payment
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post claims £50 million has been lost in licence fee payments this year.

fact_check_explanation_title: Chris Preddie wrong about Pfizer CEO not taking Covid vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: Chris Preddie OBE spreads falsehood about the Pfizer CEO refusing a Covid-19 vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pfizer CEO didn’t say he doesn’t need to be vaccinated because he’s healthy
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post falsely claims that the CEO of Pfizer hasn’t been vaccinated because he’s in good health.

fact_check_explanation_title: Screenshot of website about Covid-19 vaccine side effects is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post includes a mock-up of the MHRA’s website with a list of Covid-19 vaccine side effects.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video makes misleading claims about birth certificates and the law
fact_check_explanation_summary: All births in England, Wales and Northern Ireland must be registered within 42 days of the child being born.

fact_check_explanation_title: Too early to say whether unvaccinated doctors or nurses will lose jobs
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post suggests that thousands of unvaccinated doctors and nurses will lose their jobs

fact_check_explanation_title: Why the government recommends having 6 months left on passports to visit Europe
fact_check_explanation_summary: When returning from many European countries, your passport must be less than ten years old and be valid for at least three months.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid virus variants are real
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post also suggests that viruses aren’t real.

fact_check_explanation_title: Kabul plane was not inflatable decoy
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post claims that decoy planes were filmed in Kabul, comparing them to the dummy vehicles used during the Second World War.

fact_check_explanation_title: Cadbury World ‘promotion’ is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: A fake Cadbury World Facebook account has been harvesting personal details under the guise of giving out free chocolate hampers

fact_check_explanation_title: Did Sajid Javid open a ‘new hospital’ in Carlisle?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The new cancer centre is on the site of an old building at Carlisle Infirmary.

fact_check_explanation_title: PHE says no need to restart vaccination course in pregnancy after second dose delay
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s no problem with booking your second dose, even if it’s been a considerable amount of time since your first.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccines are recommended at any stage of pregnancy
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists recommends vaccination at any stage of pregnancy.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video of people falling from plane in Kabul shows a US aircraft
fact_check_explanation_summary: A distressing video of people falling from the underside of an aircraft leaving the airport in Kabul is being shared online.

fact_check_explanation_title: Missing girl ‘news article’ is harvesting Facebook logins
fact_check_explanation_summary: A website claiming you need to verify your age via Facebook to see a video of a suspect in a kidnapping case is not legitimate.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid testing hasn't left 12 million on NHS waiting lists
fact_check_explanation_summary: The NHS waiting list delays are more complex than that, and testing happens in lots of different settings.

fact_check_explanation_title: Trafalgar Square “Freedom Rally” speech littered with false claims
fact_check_explanation_summary: Speaker Vernon Coleman made a litany of misleading claims to an audience of hundreds in Trafalgar Square

fact_check_explanation_title: How long should you wait between vaccines if you’re pregnant?
fact_check_explanation_summary: You should wait a week between your whooping cough or flu vaccine and the Covid vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: What we know about Covid-19 vaccines and miscarriages
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s no evidence that the vaccines are causing miscarriages.

fact_check_explanation_title: What do we know about Covid-19 vaccines and fertility?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists say that there is no evidence to suggest that the Covid-19 vaccines affect fertility.

fact_check_explanation_title: How media reporting of modelling has shaped our understanding of the pandemic
fact_check_explanation_summary: Scientific modelling has been widely criticised throughout the pandemic. We spoke to some of the leading experts behind the numbers about how they felt their work had been reported .

fact_check_explanation_title: Conservative Woman article falsely claims vaccines don’t work
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that natural immunity is ‘complete’ and vaccines are ‘obsolete’ are completely false.

fact_check_explanation_title: Magna Carta can’t be used to seize Edinburgh Castle
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that the historic law can be used to lawfully dissent against the government are completely untrue.

fact_check_explanation_title: Samaritans doesn't have a text number anymore
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Facebook shares out-of-date information about contacting the charity.

fact_check_explanation_title: French ambassador hasn’t left Kabul as Robert Peston claims
fact_check_explanation_summary: The French embassy has left its building in Kabul’s diplomatic quarter and relocated to the airport.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence of ‘nanobots’ in Covid-19 test swabs
fact_check_explanation_summary: The claim follows other misinformation that parasites and nanoparticles are in the swabs.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid variants weren’t planned
fact_check_explanation_summary: A TikTok video falsely claims the variants of Covid-19 were “made up”.

fact_check_explanation_title: PCR tests are not ‘a fraud’
fact_check_explanation_summary: An interview with Kary B Mullis seems to have been taken out of context. PCR tests detect viral genetic material and are very accurate.

fact_check_explanation_title: Post makes misleading claims about Covid vaccines and animal trials
fact_check_explanation_summary: Animals used in clinical trials are usually euthanised so scientists can examine their organs.

fact_check_explanation_title: Messi didn’t double PSG’s Instagram followers
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post falsely claims that Messi signing with PSG doubled the club’s followers on Instagram.

fact_check_explanation_title: Snapchat doesn’t secretly learn the time you were born
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post incorrectly suggests that Snapchat gathers information about when you were born without your knowledge.

fact_check_explanation_title: Grant Shapps misspoke about double vaccinated people on BBC Breakfast
fact_check_explanation_summary: Rather than saying that double vaccinated people are much less likely to get and carry coronavirus, which is true, he mistakenly said that they were more likely.

fact_check_explanation_title: Registering as a car’s keeper doesn’t automatically mean you don’t own it
fact_check_explanation_summary: Vehicles should be registered in the name of the person who uses it.

fact_check_explanation_title: Higher deportation rates don’t necessarily demonstrate ‘disproportionate targeting’ of Jamaicans
fact_check_explanation_summary: The data is not entirely reliable, and there may be multiple reasons why deportation rates vary, including whether deportation would affect someone’s human rights.

fact_check_explanation_title: Why it’s unlikely Geronimo the alpaca’s TB test gave a false positive
fact_check_explanation_summary: Bovine TB tests work by detecting an antibody response. But that antibody response isn’t triggered unless the animal has been infected in the past.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Pfizer vaccine, teenagers and myocarditis
fact_check_explanation_summary: There were just under 400 reported cases of myocarditis, none of them fatal, after 8.9 million teens were vaccinated in the US.

fact_check_explanation_title: What extra expenses can MPs claim if they have children?
fact_check_explanation_summary: MPs claiming for rental accommodation costs can claim an extra £5,500 per dependant.

fact_check_explanation_title: Headlines exaggerate danger of hydrogen boilers
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that hydrogen boilers could explode at quadruple the rate of conventional gas boilers ignore vital context.

fact_check_explanation_title: Reported study doesn’t talk about Alzheimer’s
fact_check_explanation_summary: It was research into the impact of dietary intake of flavonoids on subjective cognitive decline.

fact_check_explanation_title: Abortion rate lower than claimed as miscarriages not factored in
fact_check_explanation_summary: ONS data claims one in four pregnancies end in abortion, but this doesn’t count pregnancies which end in miscarriage.

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaccine deaths are not higher than Covid-19 deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article reproduced across a number of sites repeatedly draws misleading conclusions from official data.

fact_check_explanation_title: What are the rules on consent for Covid-19 vaccines for teens?
fact_check_explanation_summary: People aged 16 or over can consent to their own medical treatment.

fact_check_explanation_title: NHS Test and Trace cost £13.5 billion in its first year
fact_check_explanation_summary: £37 billion is its two year budget, but it only spent £13.5 billion in its first year, which is less than expected.

fact_check_explanation_title: Yellow Card data isn't proof of Covid-19 vaccine deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: This system provides a way of reporting and monitoring suspected reactions.

fact_check_explanation_title: There is no graphene oxide in the Covid-19 vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: The nanoparticles used in some of the vaccines are lipid nanoparticles. They are not made of graphene oxide.

fact_check_explanation_title: Australian government hasn’t admitted vaccines are a dangerous poison
fact_check_explanation_summary: Medicines are generally referred to as poisons in Western Australian legislation.

fact_check_explanation_title: Study did not show 82% of pregnancies end in miscarriage after Covid vaccination
fact_check_explanation_summary: Study did not show 82% of pregnancies end in miscarriage after Covid vaccination.

fact_check_explanation_title: The government’s numbers on savings for wine drinkers don’t add up
fact_check_explanation_summary: The government estimated its new imports policy will save wine drinkers £130 million. An industry body puts the figure at around £30 million.

fact_check_explanation_title: Costa sign demanding vaccine proof to sit in wasn’t taken in UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: In Ireland, indoor hospitality is only available to those who can prove they have been fully vaccinated or have recovered from Covid in the last six months.

fact_check_explanation_title: There are ways of testing for the Delta variant
fact_check_explanation_summary: Genomic sequencing allows scientists to identify different variants of Covid-19.

fact_check_explanation_title: Macron didn’t say he would no longer sacrifice his life for people who refuse Covid-19 vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: A speech criticising people who do not get vaccinated has been widely misattributed to French President Emmanuel Macron.

fact_check_explanation_title: Comparisons between deaths reported after swine flu and Covid-19 vaccines are misleading
fact_check_explanation_summary: Deaths reported after a Covid-19 vaccine aren’t necessarily caused by the vaccine itself.

fact_check_explanation_title: Einstein didn’t say technology would create 'generation of idiots'
fact_check_explanation_summary: Versions of the quote appear to have been circulating on the internet for almost a decade.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence that Jeff Rothschild ever called for WW3 to bring about a ‘new world order’
fact_check_explanation_summary: The quote has been widely shared for years, but there is no proof that he ever said it.

fact_check_explanation_title: Israel’s travel policy doesn’t view vaccinated passengers as higher risk
fact_check_explanation_summary: Suggestions that Israel postponing the lifting of travel restrictions on vaccinated tourists indicates they are high risk ignores the fact that unvaccinated travellers are restricted too.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence that smell of rosemary boosts memory by 75%
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post based on a small research study falsely claims rosemary massively boosts memory.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video of Uber driver throwing passenger into a fountain is a prank
fact_check_explanation_summary: Video of Uber driver throwing passenger into a fountain is a prank

fact_check_explanation_title: 5G tower with ‘Delta’ power system is not related to Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: Photos of a 5G tower supported by ‘Delta’ power system has nothing to do with Covid-19.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence birds found dead on ship were killed by 5G
fact_check_explanation_summary: Misleading Facebook post claims that hundreds of dead birds discovered on the deck of a ship were killed by 5G.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral impala picture is not a maternal sacrifice
fact_check_explanation_summary: The photographer says the impala was probably in shock and paralysed with fear.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fruit Shoot and oranges can’t test positive for Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: What looks like a positive result is actually just the lateral flow test breaking due to it being used improperly.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence homeopathic nosodes can help side effects from vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Instagram claims that a used plaster could be used to help side effects from unspecified vaccines.

fact_check_explanation_title: Placebo recipients are treated as vaccinated for 16 weeks once trials end
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Department of Health has said that Covid-19 vaccine trial participants (current and future) should be considered as fully vaccinated.

fact_check_explanation_title: The CDC has not said PCR tests don’t work
fact_check_explanation_summary: The CDC has announced it will no longer request authorisation for one type of PCR test. It is recommending others instead because they are more efficient.

fact_check_explanation_title: Tanks in Paris were almost certainly there for Bastille Day
fact_check_explanation_summary: Social media posts have misleadingly suggested tanks were deployed in Paris in response to protests.

fact_check_explanation_title: Daily cancer deaths not higher than those from Covid during last 40 days
fact_check_explanation_summary: Communications consultant James Melville compares Covid-19 and cancer deaths but his figures aren’t correct.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post on tetanus jabs gets a lot wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: It is not true that if a wound bleeds, there’s no chance you have tetanus.

fact_check_explanation_title: Robert Peston overstated the importance of reinfections
fact_check_explanation_summary: It is true that people testing positive for Covid-19 more than once are not counted in the daily case figures—but it would only make a small difference to the total …

fact_check_explanation_title: Mandatory Covid-19 vaccine is only for care home workers
fact_check_explanation_summary: An amendment to the Health and Social Care Act has been criticised because it did not include a full impact assessment.

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaccines reduce the risk of death but don’t eliminate it altogether
fact_check_explanation_summary: Large numbers of people (including vulnerable populations) have been vaccinated, and therefore PHE statistics show that there are still deaths amongst vaccinated people.

fact_check_explanation_title: Was Dawn Butler right about Boris Johnson ‘lying’ to Parliament?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Dawn Butler was removed from the Commons for claiming that the Prime Minister lied.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson hasn’t had three Covid-19 vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: One of the pictures circulated on social media shows the PM receiving a flu vaccination.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson was wrong to say that “everybody” is entitled to extra self-isolation support
fact_check_explanation_summary: People are not entitled to the equivalent of the living wage while they self-isolate, and a £500 support payment is only for those on benefits or in hardship.

fact_check_explanation_title: Double vaccinated people do not make up 60% of Covid-19 hospitalisations
fact_check_explanation_summary: Sir Patrick Vallance, the government’s chief scientific adviser, has corrected comments he made at a press conference.

fact_check_explanation_title: Richard Tice makes misleading claims about Covid-19 vaccines and fertility
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Reform UK leader’s claim is based on Yellow Card and VAERS data, which does not show proven adverse reactions to the vaccines.

fact_check_explanation_title: Young people do face a small risk from Covid
fact_check_explanation_summary: Death and severe disease are very unlikely, but there is not no risk of them “at all”.

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaccines have not caused daily cases to increase
fact_check_explanation_summary: There are more daily cases than July of last year despite high vaccine coverage.

fact_check_explanation_title: Children are very unlikely to die of Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: The risk of death is one in tens of thousands even if they catch it, and the risk of serious illness is very low too.

fact_check_explanation_title: TfL is part of self-isolation pilot scheme
fact_check_explanation_summary: TfL initially suggested it wasn’t part of the scheme. Boris Johnson and Rishi Sunak said they wouldn't be self-isolating due to being part of the pilot themselves, before the decision …

fact_check_explanation_title: Average Covid-19 victim dies years before they otherwise would
fact_check_explanation_summary: In an allegedly leaked WhatsApp message, Boris Johnson appeared to claim that the average age of Covid-19 deaths is higher than the average life expectancy.

fact_check_explanation_title: Free paper repeats falsehoods on deaths following vaccination
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s no proof 1,400 people have died because of the vaccination.

fact_check_explanation_title: Lord Sumption made several errors about Covid on Today
fact_check_explanation_summary: More than 100,000 deaths have been caused by Covid, and it has killed thousands of people who had no pre-existing condition.

fact_check_explanation_title: The EU doesn’t have a 40% tariff on African food imports
fact_check_explanation_summary: This was claimed by MP George Freeman when outlining the UK’s commitment to developing nations.

fact_check_explanation_title: Photo doesn’t show Covid protest in Paris
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely shared photograph on social media was actually taken during World Cup celebrations in 2018.

fact_check_explanation_title: A fall in death rates doesn’t prove Covid-19 isn’t killing anyone
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post falsely claims that lower death rates prove Covid-19 is not killing anyone.

fact_check_explanation_title: Allison Pearson tweets misleading stats about Covid hospital patients
fact_check_explanation_summary: Telegraph columnist Allison Pearson’s calculation of Covid hospitalisation rate is flawed in multiple ways.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Rife machines can cure all cancers
fact_check_explanation_summary: Cancer Research UK says there is no reliable evidence to use Rife machines as a treatment for cancer.

fact_check_explanation_title: Figure of 100,000 children missing from school is out of date
fact_check_explanation_summary: An Evening Standard article claims that almost 100,000 children have not returned to school since the start of the pandemic.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post about wolves makes howling errors
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post about wolf pack behaviour makes a number of false claims.

fact_check_explanation_title: Your fuel tank won’t explode if you fill it during a heatwave
fact_check_explanation_summary: The auto-combustion point of fuel is much, much higher than a car’s fuel tank could feasibly reach.

fact_check_explanation_title: Churchill’s photograph has not been removed from Google
fact_check_explanation_summary: It temporarily disappeared from one part of the search results last year, but was restored on 14 June 2020.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral social media picture doesn’t show world’s oldest living land animal
fact_check_explanation_summary: The tortoise in the post was actually in his 50s when pictured.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence three presidents died because they refused vaccines for their nations
fact_check_explanation_summary: One died due to problems with his heart, one died of pneumonia at age 97, and another was assassinated with no sign that this was related to a stance on …

fact_check_explanation_title: Image shows a retreating wolf, not a protector
fact_check_explanation_summary: None of the wolves in this image are female, and rather than working as a unit and protecting a partner’s neck, the cowering wolf is turning away.

fact_check_explanation_title: Adverse event reports after vaccines are not necessarily due to vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: Reports of adverse events following vaccines could indicate a vaccine is the cause, but this isn’t proof in and of itself.

fact_check_explanation_title: Stonehenge wasn’t built in the 1950s
fact_check_explanation_summary: Old photographs of scaffolding show the stones being restored, not constructed.

fact_check_explanation_title: This isn’t a real image of the Northern Lights from space
fact_check_explanation_summary: This image of the Northern Lights from space is a computer generation, but many real images of the phenomenon from space exist.

fact_check_explanation_title: Acidic foods don’t test positive for Covid
fact_check_explanation_summary: Posts on Facebook wrongly claim that high acid foods appear to test positive for Covid-19 on lateral flow devices

fact_check_explanation_title: No record of Sir David Attenborough talking about red and black ants in a jar
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s no evidence the broadcaster ever made the analogy credited to him.

fact_check_explanation_title: What has the Prime Minister said about the booing of England players?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Keir Starmer says that Boris Johnson did not condemn the booing, but Boris Johnson reportedly did say that it was “totally wrong”.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Pfizer vaccine isn’t 99% graphene oxide
fact_check_explanation_summary: The MHRA has said these claims are ‘completely incorrect’, and the study that has been used to back up the claims has a number of inaccuracies and flaws.

fact_check_explanation_title: Nine in 10 girls did not say they’d been sent explicit images
fact_check_explanation_summary: Maria Miller is the latest person to misinterpret Ofsted’s survey on abuse in schools

fact_check_explanation_title: New study estimates mask wearing could cut R number by 25%, not 0.25
fact_check_explanation_summary: Greater Manchester mayor Andy Burnham appeared to misquote the study on the Today programme

fact_check_explanation_title: Golden oldies: Are one in five  pensioners millionaires?
fact_check_explanation_summary: A quarter of over 65s live in households with wealth above a million pounds.

fact_check_explanation_title: Italy aren’t going to be disqualified from Euro 2020
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims the Azzurri fielded a suspended player in the final are false.

fact_check_explanation_title: A Portuguese court hasn’t said there have only been 152 Covid deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: This was just the number of deaths recorded by doctors from the Ministry of Justice, who typically only deal with deaths where there is a suspicion of foul play.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Covid-19 vaccines are 'overwhelming' NHS services
fact_check_explanation_summary: A website article misleadingly claims the Covid-19 vaccine drive has “overwhelmed” the NHS.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video shares falsehoods about face masks and asymptomatic spread of Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: Footage of a meeting in Orange County, California, in 2020 shares a lot of false information about asymptomatic spread of Covid-19 and the use of facemasks.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral Euro 2020 video shows football fans pushing into Wembley Stadium
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that a video shows England and Italy fans clashing after the match are inaccurate.

fact_check_explanation_title: US fact checking site did not endorse a Fox News broadcast
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video of a Fox News broadcast has been altered to incorrectly suggest US fact checking organisation PolitiFact endorsed it.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 mutated long before mass vaccine roll-outs
fact_check_explanation_summary: All four variants of concern were identified before mass vaccine roll-outs.

fact_check_explanation_title: WHO advice about asymptomatic transmission has changed since the start of the pandemic
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video claiming to show Matt Hancock saying WHO had told him there was little asymptomatic transmission of Covid-19 takes his words out of context.

fact_check_explanation_title: Royal attendance at Euros does not prove there’s no pandemic
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post wrongly suggests the presence of the Royal Family at the England vs Germany Euros 2020 match proves there’s no pandemic.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 and flu comparisons reappraised
fact_check_explanation_summary: The health secretary has been criticised for saying we have to live with Covid as we do with flu. But how do the two compare, now most adults are vaccinated?

fact_check_explanation_title: No, ‘woke’ culture war isn’t the biggest dividing line in Britain
fact_check_explanation_summary: It came seventh when people were asked about it in a recent survey.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video of man reporting Covid-19 crimes to police is full of misinformation
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral video contains a list of debunked theories about the vaccine and disease.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video in a car shares misinformation about Covid-19 vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: This video makes a number of false claims about the Covid-19 pandemic.

fact_check_explanation_title: Why school testing data doesn’t tell the whole story
fact_check_explanation_summary: Data is based on tests reported and so excludes the many tests taken but not reported.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pouring diluted cordial onto a Covid-19 test won’t give an accurate result
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Facebook claims the tests are a ‘big farce’ because cordial appears to test positive.

fact_check_explanation_title: Was Michael Gove right about court ruling over bias in contracts?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Cabinet Minister claimed on Sky News that there was no actual bias and no breach of the ministerial code in the decision to award a contract to Public First.

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaccinated people sometimes die of Covid-19—but very rarely
fact_check_explanation_summary: Many of the most at-risk people have been vaccinated, which is why figures from Public Health England show that some have still died.

fact_check_explanation_title: Only a third of people first heard of the term ‘cancel culture’ in the past year
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article in The Sun far overstates the number of people who have heard of cancel culture.

fact_check_explanation_title: What we know about Matt Hancock’s alleged use of private email
fact_check_explanation_summary: Downing Street initially denied accusations that Mr Hancock and Lord Bethell used private email addresses during the pandemic.

fact_check_explanation_title: World Economic Forum founder did not write book about ‘organised epidemics’
fact_check_explanation_summary: An essay passage that claims humanity will be wiped out by ‘organised epidemics‘ has been wrongly attributed to World Economic Forum founder Klaus Schwab

fact_check_explanation_title: How common is sexual abuse in schools?
fact_check_explanation_summary: An Ofsted survey did not show that 90% of girls experienced it, although it does appear to be a common problem, from other evidence.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ketchup, squash and fruit do not deliver positive Covid-19 results
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some foods can break a lateral flow test and cause a second line to appear. This rarely happens when the tests are used properly, on people.

fact_check_explanation_title: Critical report on BBC Newsround story is misleading
fact_check_explanation_summary: A report has criticised aspects of BBC childrens’ show Newsround’s coverage on Covid-19 vaccines but misleads in the process.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pandemic school attendance: fact checked
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Centre for Social Justice has described around 93,000 pupils as “severely absent” in the 2020 autumn term.

fact_check_explanation_title: Website makes false claims about vaccines and miscarriages
fact_check_explanation_summary: Daily Expose has claimed that the Covid-19 vaccine is to blame for dozens of miscarriages. There is no evidence for this.

fact_check_explanation_title: Telegraph suggests 9% of England dies each year
fact_check_explanation_summary: The article confuses an annual death rate with a monthly death rate.

fact_check_explanation_title: The BMJ didn’t say PCR tests are useless
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post uses a BMJ article to support a claim about PCR testing, but doesn’t include some important context about the article it’s referencing.

fact_check_explanation_title: NHS says you should perform rescue breaths on children who aren’t breathing
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely shared infographic suggests that CPR for children involves chest compressions only. But NHS advice is to also give rescue breaths (mouth to mouth).

fact_check_explanation_title: Instagram post gets it wrong about Covid-19 vaccines and animal testing
fact_check_explanation_summary: An Instagram post has repeated falsehoods about the survival rate for Covid-19 and vaccine testing on animals.

fact_check_explanation_title: Government modelling not proof of vaccine ‘genocide’
fact_check_explanation_summary: Estimates that most people who will die of Covid this summer will be vaccinated reflects the high rate of vaccination, not any harm of vaccines.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post about poppy graffiti on mosque is misleading
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post about two men who defaced a mosque with a poppy picture doesn’t say what other offences they admitted.

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaccinated people are not warned against flying
fact_check_explanation_summary: This Covid-19 rumour has spread from Russia to Spain to Australia and the UK, but it isn’t true.

fact_check_explanation_title: The deadline for opting out of the NHS GP data collection has changed
fact_check_explanation_summary: NHS Digital will start collecting the data at the start of September.

fact_check_explanation_title: British Airways hasn’t told their pilots they don’t need Covid-19 vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post has also shared baseless claims that some airlines are considering banning vaccinated passengers.

fact_check_explanation_title: Herald suggests Scotland’s 2006 smoking ban behind drop in heart attacks since 1990
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article in The Herald misleadingly suggested the 2006 Scottish smoking ban was behind a 74% drop in heart attacks since 1990.

fact_check_explanation_title: The WHO hasn’t said women should be banned from drinking
fact_check_explanation_summary: Confusion seems to stem from a published first draft of the WHO’s global alcohol action plan, which talks about ‘appropriate’ prevention measures among women who are pregnant or of 'childbearing …

fact_check_explanation_title: Charles Bronson has not attacked Ian Huntley
fact_check_explanation_summary: The two men are in different prisons.

fact_check_explanation_title: You do not need a doctor’s letter to prove exemption from face coverings
fact_check_explanation_summary: Wearing face coverings in certain settings is now a legal requirement but you do not need a doctor’s letter to prove that you are exempt.

fact_check_explanation_title: The NHS isn’t asking for payment for Covid-19 vaccination passes
fact_check_explanation_summary: Scam emails purporting to be from the NHS are demanding money for a ‘Coronavirus Digital Passport’ to prove vaccination status.

fact_check_explanation_title: All health secretaries become a shareholder of Genomics England
fact_check_explanation_summary: This is a part of the job, rather than a personal role for Matt Hancock.

fact_check_explanation_title: Japan hasn’t banned Olympic athletes from taking the knee
fact_check_explanation_summary: Rules prohibiting demonstrations or protests at Olympic venues have been in place for decades.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ronaldo didn’t visit a mosque in Birmingham
fact_check_explanation_summary: Footage of a lookalike of the Portuguese footballer has been widely shared online.

fact_check_explanation_title: ‘My First Vape’ toy is not real
fact_check_explanation_summary: The mocked up packaging was produced by a Twitter account previously behind a children’s ‘Happy Hour Playset’.

fact_check_explanation_title: You can’t tell how a banana was ripened by looking at it
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that naturally ripened bananas look different from chemically ripened bananas are false.

fact_check_explanation_title: Hydroxychloroquine study not all that it seems
fact_check_explanation_summary: Patients may have been given more of the drug because they lived longer—not the other way around.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fake memo circulating claiming to be from Imperial College
fact_check_explanation_summary: The memo allegedly sets out plans for a permanent lockdown of the UK but has no credible source and makes false claims.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 victims cannot be cremated against their wishes
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Facebook also wrongly claims that asymptomatic transmission is a hoax, PCR tests are useless and Covid-19 death statistics have been manipulated.

fact_check_explanation_title: April’s trade figures fact checked
fact_check_explanation_summary: Covid-19 and Brexit mean trade volumes are incredibly volatile at the moment. We take a look at some of the claims about the latest data.

fact_check_explanation_title: British Airways is not in ‘crisis talks’ with the government about vaccinated pilots
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is no evidence three pilots died of the Covid-19 vaccine. Four pilots have recently died, but BA says these are not linked.

fact_check_explanation_title: 97% of PCR positives aren’t false
fact_check_explanation_summary: A clip of a woman calling a Bristol hospital claiming most of its “positive” cases are false has been shared on social media.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims that Covid vaccine spike proteins are harmful are unevidenced
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Conservative Woman article repeats claims from a Canadian vaccine scientist that appear to be based on flawed assumptions.

fact_check_explanation_title: The UK will cut aid this year, but barely did last year
fact_check_explanation_summary: The UK spends more on aid than most G7 countries, although the gap will close in 2021.

fact_check_explanation_title: Labour’s record on unemployment
fact_check_explanation_summary: Labour has led the UK government on six occasions. Unemployment rose during five of those.

fact_check_explanation_title: More than 30 people are allowed to protest
fact_check_explanation_summary: Under current Covid-19 regulations, more than 30 people can protest in England if it has been organised by an accepted body and risk assessments have taken place.

fact_check_explanation_title: David Icke makes false claim that vaccines are ‘gene therapy’
fact_check_explanation_summary: Conspiracy theorist David Icke has made unsubstantiated claims about Covid-19 transmission , climate change and gene therapy.

fact_check_explanation_title: Don’t use washing up liquid to remove ticks
fact_check_explanation_summary: Although this may sometimes work, there are better methods which could help to reduce the risk of contracting a disease from a tick.

fact_check_explanation_title: Christian Eriksen did not have Covid-19 vaccine before collapse, says Inter Milan CEO
fact_check_explanation_summary: Users on social media are sharing false claims that the Danish footballer had been vaccinated days before becoming ill on the pitch.

fact_check_explanation_title: Possible link between Pfizer second dose and mild heart inflammation in young men
fact_check_explanation_summary: Most men studied in Israel had to go into hospital for a few days but the majority of cases were quite mild.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 is real and not a government euthanasia policy
fact_check_explanation_summary: Covid-19 and SARS-CoV-2 are well recognised, and there is no evidence that midazolam has been used as part of a euthanasia policy designed to kill Covid-19 patients.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson was broadly right about aid spending
fact_check_explanation_summary: The government’s plan to reduce foreign aid will still mean spending more on it than past governments did.

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s no evidence Covid-19 vaccines make the disease worse
fact_check_explanation_summary: Experts say animal studies, clinical trials, and increasing real world data add to evidence that Covid-19 vaccines are not causing antibody dependent enhancement.

fact_check_explanation_title: Matt Hancock used the phrase ‘protective ring’ about care homes long before he claims
fact_check_explanation_summary: Records show the Health Secretary used the phrase about care homes in May 2020 to describe actions taken in the first wave of the pandemic.

fact_check_explanation_title: A magnet won’t stick to a glass vaccine vial
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely-shared social media video claims to show a magnet sticking to what appears to be a vaccine vial.

fact_check_explanation_title: Piers Corbyn makes misleading claims about vaccine deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: Piers Corbyn has falsely claimed vaccines caused over a thousand deaths and nearly a million adverse reactions.

fact_check_explanation_title: What’s happening with your NHS data?
fact_check_explanation_summary: We cover whether your data’s being sold, the types of opt-out available and what exactly has changed.

fact_check_explanation_title: Govt advice differs for travel to some amber list islands
fact_check_explanation_summary: The FCDO advises against non-essential travel to amber list countries, but makes exemptions for some islands of these countries

fact_check_explanation_title: Poster about Yellow Card scheme is not real
fact_check_explanation_summary: The MHRA has confirmed that a poster spreading on social media which makes claims about vaccine approvals does not come from them.

fact_check_explanation_title: Hecklers at Twickenham Stadium vaccine drive spout false claims
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video filmed by protestors at Twickenham Stadium repeats Covid-19 vaccine claims we’ve debunked several times before.

fact_check_explanation_title: Telegraph columnist wrongly claims literacy at the lowest level in UK history
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Telegraph article was wrong to say literacy was at its lowest level in history, and that every international league table puts the UK near bottom for literacy and numeracy. …

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccines are very effective
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some people are unlikely to get ill with Covid anyway, but that doesn’t mean that the vaccines offer less protection.

fact_check_explanation_title: More than 10 people are dying of Covid-19 each week in the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: Julia Hartley-Brewer claimed on talkRADIO that fewer than 10 people a week are now dying from Covid-19. This is untrue.

fact_check_explanation_title: This Morning guest makes misleading claims on vaccine efficacy
fact_check_explanation_summary: Evidence points to the fact that vaccines do stop you catching Covid and spreading it.

fact_check_explanation_title: The BBC did not claim 350 people attended anti-lockdown protests
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely shared screenshot suggesting otherwise has itself been faked.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ian Brown wrong to claim Japan refuses blood from anyone who’s been vaccinated
fact_check_explanation_summary: Lead singer of The Stone Roses, Ian Brown, has falsely claimed that Japan has stopped anyone vaccinated for Covid-19 from giving blood.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Nobel Laureate said vaccinated people will die in two years
fact_check_explanation_summary: Luc Montagnier has expressed opposition to Covid-19 vaccines.

fact_check_explanation_title: Matt Hancock wrong about number of Bolton vaccinations
fact_check_explanation_summary: Official figures put the town’s highest number of people vaccinated in a single day at 5,465, not tens of thousands.

fact_check_explanation_title: The media must stop using misleading headlines
fact_check_explanation_summary: Often the article doesn’t actually say what the headline promised. We call this an ‘edline’.

fact_check_explanation_title: The UK does not have the worst death toll in Europe, when you account for population
fact_check_explanation_summary: It has recorded the 14th highest number of Covid-19 deaths per million people.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Covid-19 vaccines have not only been tested on healthy people as claimed
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video on Facebook makes various claims about Covid-19 vaccines which are wrong or could use more context.

fact_check_explanation_title: Are senior civil servants really as privileged as they were 50 years ago?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The proportion of senior civil servants classed as being from a lower socioeconomic band has remained about the same, but the size of that band overall has shrunk considerably.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Moderna vaccine contains SM-102 not chloroform
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely circulated video of a product safety leaflet for SM-102, shows the profile of SM-102 in solution with chloroform, which is known for its toxicity.

fact_check_explanation_title: Getting a Covid-19 vaccine doesn’t mean you can connect to Bluetooth
fact_check_explanation_summary: This rumour is totally false.

fact_check_explanation_title: Dandelion root is not a proven cancer cure
fact_check_explanation_summary: It has been shown to have some effect in lab studies, and in mice, but evidence in humans is lacking.

fact_check_explanation_title: Having a Covid-19 vaccine doesn’t make you more vulnerable to the disease
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post that claims people who are vaccinated may become particularly ill from ‘vaccine enhancement syndrome’ is completely wrong.

fact_check_explanation_title: Can I go to amber list countries?
fact_check_explanation_summary: There have been conflicting reports on the reasons you can travel to amber status countries from England.

fact_check_explanation_title: Freedom March video littered with false claims about Covid-19 cures
fact_check_explanation_summary: A speech made by a prominent anti-lockdown influencer includes false claims about Ivermectin, vitamin D and hydroxychloroquine.

fact_check_explanation_title: The risk of dying from a Covid vaccine is lower than 1 in 31,000
fact_check_explanation_summary: While children have a very low risk of dying from Covid, the reported death rate of 1 in 3.5 million is not quite right.

fact_check_explanation_title: Dead birds in India were not killed by 5G
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post falsely claims hundreds of birds in India were killed by 5G.

fact_check_explanation_title: The so-called ‘Indian variants’  have been found in lots of countries
fact_check_explanation_summary: The UK has sequenced high numbers of cases, but sequencing has shown that the variant is present in lots of other countries too.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Sir David Attenborough made viral comments about HS2
fact_check_explanation_summary: Thousands of people have shared a quote attributed to the broadcaster about a tree felled for HS2.

fact_check_explanation_title: Trade data doesn’t show we knew about Covid in 2018
fact_check_explanation_summary: Diagnostic tests were relabelled as Covid-19 diagnostic tests in some trade data, which then appeared to show Covid tests being exported in 2018.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccines haven’t caused 3,362 deaths in America
fact_check_explanation_summary: Events reported to the VAERS system in the US weren’t necessarily caused by the vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fake missing child reports used to scam Facebook users
fact_check_explanation_summary: Reports of a missing child called Ellie Morrad are fake. Fake missing child reports are a common occurrence on Facebook.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims about teeth whitening inquiries don’t add up
fact_check_explanation_summary: Articles claimed Londoners made more searches than any other UK city for teeth whitening. The study failed to adjust for population.

fact_check_explanation_title: These cars were not abandoned because their batteries failed
fact_check_explanation_summary: The electric cars were part of a French car-sharing business, which stopped trading suddenly in 2018.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims about Russia, Covid-19 and 5G are almost all false
fact_check_explanation_summary: Russia was not the first country to perform an autopsy on a Covid-19 victim.

fact_check_explanation_title: Police tweet about helicopter joy riders in Merseyside is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: A mock tweet from Merseyside Police falsely claimed four men took an air ambulance helicopter on a joyride.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 pandemic was not planned by Rockefeller Foundation
fact_check_explanation_summary: False claims on social media say plans for the coronavirus pandemic were published years ago.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Genocide Act of 1969 has not just been repealed
fact_check_explanation_summary: The act was repealed in 2001, but replaced by another law making genocide illegal.

fact_check_explanation_title: Animal sentience in UK law
fact_check_explanation_summary: Animal welfare laws in the UK already acknowledge that animals can feel pain and suffer, but it has not been spelled out explicitly that they are sentient as in EU …

fact_check_explanation_title: 1,102 people haven’t died ‘of’ the Covid-19 vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: This is how many people have died a short period after getting vaccinated.

fact_check_explanation_title: A George Floyd mural in Manchester was not chosen over a Lee Rigby memorial
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post falsely claims that Manchester councillors approved a George Floyd mural over one of Lee Rigby.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccines do not make you magnetic
fact_check_explanation_summary: Baseless claims that the Covid-19 vaccines contain a microchip have persisted throughout the pandemic.

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s no AI in vaccines creating fertility problems in unvaccinated people
fact_check_explanation_summary: Another conspiracy theory from David Icke is being shared on social media.

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s not clear whether bald people get more ill with Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: Several newspapers have reported that being bald doubles your risk of severe Covid, but this is far from certain.

fact_check_explanation_title: Why is the Nuremberg Code being used to oppose Covid-19 vaccines?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Social media users are incorrectly citing the medical ethics code to argue against Covid-19 vaccination.

fact_check_explanation_title: A mistake in the New York Post has been misconstrued as a sign of Covid-19 conspiracy
fact_check_explanation_summary: The paper used a picture of scenes from a gas leak in India in 2020, not the Covid-19 crisis in 2021. But this seems to be a simple mistake, which …

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s no evidence that eating cucumbers stops lung cancer
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post misreported some scientific papers on mice, lung cancer and a chemical in cucumbers.

fact_check_explanation_title: Honey, ginger and pepper isn’t approved treatment for Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: This home remedy has not been approved by the World Health Organisation. The WhatsApp message it’s been widely shared through is very similar to Facebook posts which have already been …

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral video spreads misinformation about ethylene oxide and Ivermectin
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is no evidence that using something that has been sterilised with ethylene oxide, such as a Covid-19 swab, is harmful.

fact_check_explanation_title: Conflicting claims about ‘new’ cancer drug thanks to Brexit are both misleading
fact_check_explanation_summary: The medication has been authorised for a new and slightly different use, but the medication itself is not new.

fact_check_explanation_title: You don’t usually need photo ID to pick up a parcel
fact_check_explanation_summary: This was suggested by the Prime Minister’s spokesperson and Gillian Keegan MP in defence of plans to require voters to have photo ID.

fact_check_explanation_title: The BBC didn’t edit the headline of a Scottish newspaper
fact_check_explanation_summary: The headline of an article about the Scottish election results was changed by the newspaper.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pictures of Parliament don’t tell the whole story
fact_check_explanation_summary: Facebook memes about MP attendance exclude important information.

fact_check_explanation_title: How the BBC makes money
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s not just funded by the licence fee or public money as the Sun suggested. Around 30% is from commercial operations.

fact_check_explanation_title: Sun wrong to claim lockdown doubled suicide rates
fact_check_explanation_summary: Evidence suggests suicides did not increase after the first lockdown.

fact_check_explanation_title: Letter to MHRA is filled with false Covid-19 claims
fact_check_explanation_summary: These include falsehoods that all people who die after a positive Covid test are registered as having died of Covid and that the Covid vaccines are experimental.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral video includes lots of false claims and half truths
fact_check_explanation_summary: These include claims that there is a blanket approach to DNACPRs on elderly and disabled people, that the Covid-19 vaccines are experimental and genocidal, and that the Covid-19 pandemic was …

fact_check_explanation_title: New York Post’s use of old India gas leak picture causes confusion
fact_check_explanation_summary: The paper used a picture of scenes from a gas leak in 2020, not Covid-19 in 2021.

fact_check_explanation_title: Prince William is not leading a global depopulation agenda
fact_check_explanation_summary: Agenda 21 is a sustainable development plan published by the UN in 1992, not a “global depopulation plan”.

fact_check_explanation_title: The term ‘double mutants’ doesn’t mean much
fact_check_explanation_summary: This term has been used a lot in reference to the so-called ‘Indian variant’ of Covid-19 which has multiple mutations, and so do many of the other variants.

fact_check_explanation_title: The PM’s brother did not join Dyson days after tax texts
fact_check_explanation_summary: Jo Johnson joined Dyson’s university, not the company, in February, but the texts were sent in March.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson repeats misleading council tax comparison
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Prime Minister claimed that band D average council tax is higher in Labour areas than Conservative ones. But band D rates are not a fair comparison. Average tax in …

fact_check_explanation_title: This map in the Daily Express uses all the wrong numbers
fact_check_explanation_summary: No UK regions reported zero “new daily cases” of Covid-19 on the day before.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims 163 million people searched ‘how to hit a woman so no one knows’ are untrue
fact_check_explanation_summary: The researcher behind the claim has publicly stated that her research methods were flawed.

fact_check_explanation_title: The risk of vaccination does not rise when Covid-19 becomes scarcer
fact_check_explanation_summary: What changes is the balance of risk—meaning that for some people the risk of getting seriously ill with Covid eventually becomes even smaller than the risk from vaccination.

fact_check_explanation_title: Influencer video full of untrue vaccine claims
fact_check_explanation_summary: These include false claims that all animals in Covid vaccine trials died and that vaccines can change your DNA.

fact_check_explanation_title: Telegraph headline linking depression and social media isn't backed up by article
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Telegraph article with a headline about teenage depression doubling due to social media did not get this information from the study it cites.

fact_check_explanation_title: 'Fake' WW1 photo contains kernel of truth
fact_check_explanation_summary: A photo of a WW1 battalion after returning from war in 1918 is not real. But it is based on real events.

fact_check_explanation_title: Donkey being carried out of compassion, not self-preservation
fact_check_explanation_summary: The donkey in a widely shared image was carried by soldiers because it was too weak to keep up, not in order to stop it from detonating landmines.

fact_check_explanation_title: Bill Gates has not bought Telegram
fact_check_explanation_summary: Instagram post falsely claims Bill Gates has bought the messaging app Telegram.

fact_check_explanation_title: Independent adviser can't launch investigations into ministers—they should
fact_check_explanation_summary: The adviser can raise issues of concern confidentially with the Prime Minister, but not trigger investigations.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson promised to publish his Dyson communications—we’re still waiting on “all the details”
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Prime Minister originally said he would share ‘all the details’ with the House of Commons and ‘communications’ would be published.

fact_check_explanation_title: Photo of Mike Tyson in ‘Plan-Demic’ t-shirt has been edited
fact_check_explanation_summary: A photo of Mike Tyson wearing a t-shirt promoting the ‘Plan-Demic’ conspiracy theory has been altered

fact_check_explanation_title: Viewers spot Lorraine Kelly Himalayas gaffe
fact_check_explanation_summary: The TV personality claimed photos showed how visibility of the Himalayas changed after lockdown. The ‘before’ image was edited and not real.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence rapper DMX had Covid-19 vaccine before his death
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is no evidence that rapper DMX had a Covid-19 vaccine before he died of a heart attack.

fact_check_explanation_title: Home Office denies £77,000 was spent on eyebrows and beauty products
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Home Office said the sum was spent on PPE, not beauty products.

fact_check_explanation_title: Prince Philip did not dress up in a bearskin for a prank
fact_check_explanation_summary: He was the Colonel of the Grenadier Guards, and this was his uniform. A famous photograph shows him and the Queen laughing when an event was disrupted by bees.

fact_check_explanation_title: Images of decorated room are not the Downing Street refurbishment
fact_check_explanation_summary: It is a picture taken from previous work of interior designer and co-founder of Soane Britain, Lulu Lytle.

fact_check_explanation_title: Police cars don’t need MOT registration
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some categories of vehicles, including police vehicles, don’t have to have an up-to-date MOT registration.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ketchup did not ‘test positive’ for Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: You’re more likely to get a false negative than a false positive from a lateral flow test.

fact_check_explanation_title: Conservative support may have fallen—but not when the Guardian says it did
fact_check_explanation_summary: The poll in question was conducted before coverage of a disagreement between Number 10 and Dominic Cummings, so this could not have affected the results, as suggested.

fact_check_explanation_title: What are lateral flow tests, and why do the numbers of false positives keep changing?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Lateral flow tests have been used for a little while now. Here we talk about how accurate they are, and why so many different numbers on false positives are being …

fact_check_explanation_title: There were nowhere near one million people at the anti-lockdown march
fact_check_explanation_summary: The march passed under Waterloo Bridge in 50 minutes. It’s unfeasible that one million people could pass through that space in 50 minutes.

fact_check_explanation_title: BBC wrong to say puppies died of Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: The BBC’s live blog confused Covid-19 with canine coronavirus

fact_check_explanation_title: The Express muddles up the dangers of Covid-19 in pregnancy
fact_check_explanation_summary: The study it describes looked at whether Covid raises the risks associated with pregnancy—not whether pregnancy raises the risks of Covid.

fact_check_explanation_title: Photo of 2018 anti-Brexit march mislabelled as showing 2021 anti-lockdown march
fact_check_explanation_summary: An aerial image is claimed to be from the 24 April anti-lockdown march in London. It was actually from a 2018 march against Brexit.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 child vaccine trial paused over clot concerns, not cot death
fact_check_explanation_summary: The study was giving the Covid-19 vaccine to children aged between six and 17, not infants.

fact_check_explanation_title: Mike Yeadon wrong again on lockdowns and face masks
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that lockdowns and face masks don’t work are false.

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s more to the claim only 32 vaccinated people were hospitalised with Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: A report in the Telegraph claimed there was only one vaccinated case per 2,300 patients. That’s highly misleading.

fact_check_explanation_title: Error-strewn paper claims face masks are ineffective and harmful
fact_check_explanation_summary: The ‘peer-reviewed paper from Stanford’ is not from Stanford and may not have been conventionally peer-reviewed.

fact_check_explanation_title: Being near to people vaccinated against Covid-19 won’t give you side effects
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is nothing in the Covid-19 vaccines used in the UK that could cause vaccine shedding.

fact_check_explanation_title: Here’s what you should know about the Lobbying Act
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Greensill story has brought the legislation back under public scrutiny, but disagreements over it are nothing new.

fact_check_explanation_title: Godfrey Bloom video makes false claims about vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: Former MEP Godfrey Bloom has made a number of false claims about Covid-19 vaccines

fact_check_explanation_title: Results of Covid-19 vaccine trials have been published and peer-reviewed
fact_check_explanation_summary: The studies have a future completion date to allow long term follow up of participants. That doesn’t mean that the data we have so far is invalid.

fact_check_explanation_title: We don’t know if the ‘Nigerian variant’ is more deadly
fact_check_explanation_summary: Although current data demonstrates a higher mortality rate for this Covid-19 variant, this is based on small numbers.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fake football quotes go viral
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some social media users have fabricated quotes about the super league attributed to Klopp and Ferguson. We spoke to one of them.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ivermectin for Covid-19 remains controversial
fact_check_explanation_summary: Ivermectin has been publicised as a potential wonder drug for Covid-19. Research so far has been promising, but is not deemed conclusive by regulators.

fact_check_explanation_title: Street fight was not filmed when lockdown eased in England
fact_check_explanation_summary: A film of a brawl in a city centre street was not taken in Luton as the pubs re-opened.

fact_check_explanation_title: The government hasn’t said the vaccine will cause a third wave of deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: Covid-19 vaccines aren’t 100% efficient, but experts aren’t predicting they will cause mass hospitalisations.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims that a quarter of all Covid-19 deaths weren’t caused by the virus misinterpret the data
fact_check_explanation_summary: Media reports of the new figures do not make it clear that this figure only relates to one week of data.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccine did not kill every animal it was tested on
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post is wrong to claim animals involved in vaccine trials died from sepsis, immune disorder or cardiac failure.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fibres from masks and swabs aren’t 'Morgellons'
fact_check_explanation_summary: Several videos on social media give false warnings about ‘Morgellons’ in face masks and Covid-19 test swabs.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post makes misleading claims about Covid-19 passports and death rate
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Facebook makes misleading claims about Covid-19 vaccines, Covid-19 passports, infection, transmission and the death rate.

fact_check_explanation_title: The weekend Covid-19 death figures need more context
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is always a lag in reports of Covid-19 deaths over the weekend.

fact_check_explanation_title: Poverty is not the same as food insecurity
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims about all households in poverty struggling to put food on the table need a closer look.

fact_check_explanation_title: Why you can’t compare deaths after a positive Covid-19 test with deaths after a vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: Deaths soon after catching Covid are usually caused by it. Deaths soon after a Covid vaccine usually are not.

fact_check_explanation_title: ‘Why would we suddenly go to them and lie?’: How councils and communities are working together to fight vaccine misinformation
fact_check_explanation_summary: For councils, increasing vaccine uptake is a matter of increasing accessibility and addressing fears by fighting misinformation. We spoke to councils across England to find out how they’re doing it.

fact_check_explanation_title: The chance of being killed by a cow and other AstraZeneca vaccine risk comparisons explained
fact_check_explanation_summary: Is it a cow? Is it a plane? The hunt for a straightforward way to explain the AstraZeneca vaccine risk is complicated.

fact_check_explanation_title: What’s a PCR test cycle threshold and why it matters
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s been falsely claimed the WHO said PCR tests are flawed. It said “weak positive” cases with high “cycle thresholds” may need to be retested.

fact_check_explanation_title: What’s going on with the AstraZeneca vaccine?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The risks, what the government has said, and what’s happening for under-30s.

fact_check_explanation_title: Zero hours workers not excluded from self-isolation payments
fact_check_explanation_summary: Payments of £500 are available to eligible low-income or benefit-receiving workers who have to self-isolate.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral video contains several false pandemic claims
fact_check_explanation_summary: A woman reading out a newspaper makes several claims about the pandemic which are false or misleading.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 is not the same as a common cold
fact_check_explanation_summary: Coronaviruses are a family of viruses which include those which cause the common cold, SARS and Covid-19.

fact_check_explanation_title: Post suggests American WW2 prisoners were British soldiers
fact_check_explanation_summary: A photo of two emaciated men are American civilian prisoners of war, not British soldiers.

fact_check_explanation_title: Rusty hand sanitiser stand doesn’t prove hand gel is poison
fact_check_explanation_summary: The stand probably rusted from exposure to water in the gel.

fact_check_explanation_title: Twitter poll results don’t show ‘wide support’ for Thailand’s travel policy
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article in The Independent claims majority support for Thailand’s decision to admit vaccinated travellers. But Twitter polls mean nothing.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fake Mirror article about oil investors on Dragons’ Den looks suspicious
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article designed to look like The Mirror claims British citizens can make £7,000 a day from home by investing in oil

fact_check_explanation_title: Everything you need to know about the Home Office’s ‘eyebrow’ spending
fact_check_explanation_summary: Clue: it wasn’t really on eyebrows, it was on PPE.
