fact_check_explanation_title: Social media video makes false claims about Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: These include common falsehoods that mRNA vaccines will change your DNA (they won’t) and that the vaccines aren’t safe and effective (they are).

fact_check_explanation_title: Lateral flow tests are not unsafe
fact_check_explanation_summary: Posts on social media are wrong to warn that the ethylene oxide used to sterilise some Covid-19 tests makes them dangerous.

fact_check_explanation_title: Government asylum claims based on unpublished data
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Home Office said 60% of asylum seekers entered the country illegally but this is based on unpublished statistics

fact_check_explanation_title: House price growth has outstripped income growth—but not by much
fact_check_explanation_summary: A chart on Facebook compares two different measures, which makes the rise in income look smaller than it was.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral instagram video falsely claims Covid-19 was planned
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video falsely claims Covid-19 has been planned and its vaccine kills.

fact_check_explanation_title: New Statesman death comparison creates misleading picture
fact_check_explanation_summary: Rising death tolls do not necessarily show people are getting sicker, as the population is ageing and growing.

fact_check_explanation_title: Is there a precedent for mandatory vaccines for care home workers?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some healthcare workers are required by their employers to have the Hepatitis B vaccine, but it's not a specific law.

fact_check_explanation_title: Police confirm officers did not suffer broken bones at Bristol protest
fact_check_explanation_summary: Avon and Somerset police initially said one officer had a broken arm and another had broken ribs.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19: Behind the death toll
fact_check_explanation_summary: We see the scale of this pandemic in another way if we look at the death toll alongside how many years of life are being lost—including among people who don’t …

fact_check_explanation_title: NASA did not fake a picture of Mars
fact_check_explanation_summary: Someone else faked the picture, then claimed that NASA did it.

fact_check_explanation_title: Inaccurate Covid vaccine ‘Q&A’: fact checked
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Covid-19 Q&A graphic has been widely shared on social media. It makes lots of inaccurate claims about the vaccines.

fact_check_explanation_title: Travel to Spain requires negative Covid test
fact_check_explanation_summary: It doesn’t appear as if confirmation of vaccination will be mandatory, though Spain is planning on introducing vaccination passports.

fact_check_explanation_title: Police have recommended the Hollie Guard app
fact_check_explanation_summary: The personal security app allows users to alert contacts if they feel unsafe.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson handgun quote is real
fact_check_explanation_summary: In 1997 he wrote ‘Nanny is confiscating their toys’ referring to gun owners following a handgun ban prompted by the Dunblane Massacre.

fact_check_explanation_title: Oranges don’t test positive for Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Facebook claims an orange tested positive for coronavirus using a lateral flow test.

fact_check_explanation_title: Unevidenced claims about the AstraZeneca vaccine on social media
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post made unevidenced claims about blood clots and the AstraZeneca vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Avoid this report about a child attack
fact_check_explanation_summary: Report on child attack uses content stolen from other stories and is highly suspicious.

fact_check_explanation_title: Here’s exactly what Nadine Dorries said on Woman’s Hour about nurses’ salaries
fact_check_explanation_summary: The health minister spoke about nurses’ husbands and partners in a discussion about pay rises, but not exactly as reported in a viral tweet.

fact_check_explanation_title: AstraZeneca does not translate to ‘weapon that kills’
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Covid-19 vaccine developer got its name from a merger of two companies.

fact_check_explanation_title: Burnt-out police car in Bristol protests was not fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: An image of a burnt-out police car taken during protests in Bristol is not ‘a prop’

fact_check_explanation_title: What’s the deal with NHS pay rises?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The 0.7% funding is on top of the proposed 1% NHS pay increase, but it will only benefit a minority of staff.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccine exports and the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: Companies in these countries have fulfilled contracts to export the vaccines to countries like the UK.

fact_check_explanation_title: Beware of scam texts claiming to be from Royal Mail
fact_check_explanation_summary: Images of text messages asking for a payment to deliver a parcel have been shared on social media.

fact_check_explanation_title: Saying your religion is ‘Freedom’ on the census won’t make it a recognised belief
fact_check_explanation_summary: To establish a recognised belief you have to win a legal claim in court.

fact_check_explanation_title: A weasel did take a ride on a woodpecker
fact_check_explanation_summary: A famous wildlife image has returned, and appears to be genuine.

fact_check_explanation_title: The infectious diseases in an ONS graph are not the ones you might expect
fact_check_explanation_summary: The ICD 10 groups “infectious diseases” in a surprising way that includes sepsis, but not flu.

fact_check_explanation_title: Germany has spent far more than £48m on test and trace
fact_check_explanation_summary: The UK has not spent £32 billion on Test and Trace so far, and Germany has spent much more than £48 million.

fact_check_explanation_title: 17 countries haven’t ‘banned’ the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: Seventeen countries in Europe have temporarily stopped using the Covid-19 vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Clapham protester is not same woman injured in Parsons Green Tube attack
fact_check_explanation_summary: Social media posts falsely claim that a woman arrested during the Clapham vigil is the same woman who was injured in the Parsons Green Tube attack.

fact_check_explanation_title: The public dislikes disruptive protests—but less than the Telegraph says
fact_check_explanation_summary: People are strongly against violence or serious disruption at protests, but opinion is more balanced when the inconvenience is smaller.

fact_check_explanation_title: Extrapolating figures around long Covid in kids is not the way to go
fact_check_explanation_summary: The prevalence of long Covid in children is not yet fully known, and we need caution when we discuss the figures.

fact_check_explanation_title: This text from a GP is real
fact_check_explanation_summary: Facebook users were concerned that a public health message sent by text from a GP surgery was not genuine. The GP practice has said it’s real.

fact_check_explanation_title: Clearing up the NHS pay debate
fact_check_explanation_summary: Parliament made a commitment to raise the total NHS budget, but did not specify how that money should be spent.

fact_check_explanation_title: Has the NHS had its budget reduced by £30 billion?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Labour claims that the Budget took £30bn out of day to day health spending, this is true if you include the withdrawal of last year’s Covid money.

fact_check_explanation_title: NHS Test and Trace has not spent £37bn so far
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on social media uses the total two-year Test and Trace budget to make misleading claims about where the money is going.

fact_check_explanation_title: What happens when pupils test positive for Covid-19?
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s been some confusion over whether pupils can return to school after a positive lateral flow test but a negative PCR result.

fact_check_explanation_title: Misleading claims about Serco’s role in Test and Trace resurface
fact_check_explanation_summary: Most of the money spent on Test and Trace goes on testing. Serco plays a big part in tracing, but does not receive a majority of the funding.

fact_check_explanation_title: Side effects from the Oxford and Pfizer vaccines are about the same
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article in the Express is misleading when it says that the Oxford Covid-19 vaccine has ‘more adverse side effects’.

fact_check_explanation_title: There are no mouse brains in Covid-19 vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral Facebook post makes a number of claims about the ingredients and side effects of vaccines.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccines haven’t caused 460 deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: Misleading claims about vaccine deaths are a misreporting of data from the Yellow Card scheme.

fact_check_explanation_title: False picture of Gogglebox's Mary goes viral again
fact_check_explanation_summary: An image of a young model is not Mary from Gogglebox but glamour model Susan Shaw

fact_check_explanation_title: Did Eat Out to Help Out cause Covid to spread?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Debate over whether the government scheme caused a rise in infections continues.

fact_check_explanation_title: Test and Trace has much larger budget than Mars Perseverance expedition
fact_check_explanation_summary: We don’t yet have figures for the entire amount spent on Test and Trace, but it is already more than NASA has spent on its latest Mars mission.

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s not clear if antidepressants cause hair loss
fact_check_explanation_summary: Research reported in the Express does not establish any link between the medication and losing your hair.

fact_check_explanation_title: Luminescent enzymes not in Covid-19 vaccine and other myths debunked
fact_check_explanation_summary: Viral claims include that Covid-19 vaccines will change your DNA (they won’t) and contain something called luciferase (they don’t).

fact_check_explanation_title: Details missing on levelling up funding
fact_check_explanation_summary: A list of priority areas due to receive early funding from the new “Levelling Up Fund” has been published. The rationale for why certain areas are prioritised has not.

fact_check_explanation_title: Tests can detect the Covid-19 virus
fact_check_explanation_summary: The false positive rate is not 100%, which would mean they gave a positive result, wrongly, every time.

fact_check_explanation_title: Is Transport for the North’s budget being reduced by 40%?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Boris Johnson denied 40% reductions to the transport body’s budget during PMQs.

fact_check_explanation_title: Moderna’s Covid-19 vaccine will not change your DNA
fact_check_explanation_summary: This is a common myth about mRNA vaccines, which give instructions to cells, but do not change their DNA.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 is not a rebrand of flu
fact_check_explanation_summary: Although sometimes flu and Covid-19 have similar symptoms, they are different illnesses caused by different organisms.

fact_check_explanation_title: HPV testing kits are not smear tests
fact_check_explanation_summary: HPV testing kits are not the same as smear tests and lead to results that can detect or not detect HPV rather than analysing changes to cervical cells.

fact_check_explanation_title: There is no evidence that people are dying from the Covid-19 vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some deaths and serious events have been recorded after vaccination, but none because of it so far

fact_check_explanation_title: Are 3 in 10 people failing to isolate?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Keir Starmer’s claim about self-isolation comes with many caveats.

fact_check_explanation_title: Guardian report on public opinion about job losses needs context
fact_check_explanation_summary: A survey found 47% of the population think job performance is an important factor in recent job losses, not necessarily the main reason.

fact_check_explanation_title: Agenda 2030 conspiracy just describes UN sustainability goals
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is no evidence that Covid-19 is being used to usher in rules that will enslave humanity as part of Agenda 2030.

fact_check_explanation_title: The link between vitamin D and Covid-19 is complex
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some studies have shown an association between vitamin D and coronavirus infections.

fact_check_explanation_title: Government advise special precautions for disposing of infectious PPE
fact_check_explanation_summary: In some places such as hospitals PPE is also disposed of as clinical waste.

fact_check_explanation_title: Nicola Sturgeon has not banned the Union Flag from Scottish government buildings
fact_check_explanation_summary: But she has instructed that the European flag be flown on a daily basis.

fact_check_explanation_title: A fake Metro cover shares false vaccine information
fact_check_explanation_summary: The real front page of the Metro on 16 February was completely different.

fact_check_explanation_title: There is evidence vaccines reduce risk of Covid-19 illness
fact_check_explanation_summary: Being ill with Covid-19 and getting infected by the virus that causes it are not the same thing.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence for drop in US sudden infant death syndrome cases
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post claims SIDS cases have fallen in the US by using a dataset which collects reports of a tiny fraction of the total.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Boris Johnson said he wanted to “lop the heads off of smelly peasants”
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post claimed Boris Johnson said he’d like to live in the middle ages so he could behead “smelly peasants”.

fact_check_explanation_title: Some farmers dye their sheep, but a photo of a neon flock has been edited
fact_check_explanation_summary: This old mock-up goes viral all the time.

fact_check_explanation_title: There are no human cells in the AstraZeneca vaccine, and it won’t give you a chimpanzee virus
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on social media makes claims about viruses from chimpanzees and human foetal cells in AstraZeneca vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: The NAO didn’t claim there was never a national PPE shortage
fact_check_explanation_summary: Health secretary Matt Hancock made this claim during an interview with the Today programme.

fact_check_explanation_title: We can’t say if Test and Trace has cost more than the Channel Tunnel—yet
fact_check_explanation_summary: £22bn is the budget for the first year of NHS Test and Trace, but we don’t know how much has actually been spent.

fact_check_explanation_title: Mask wearing doesn’t cause bacterial pneumonia
fact_check_explanation_summary: Evidence shows mask wearing may reduce the risk of bacterial infection.

fact_check_explanation_title: A surprisingly large rat is really just surprisingly close
fact_check_explanation_summary: This widely shared photograph uses a technique called forced perspective.

fact_check_explanation_title: Many more than 3,000 people have died of Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: The true death toll is currently more than 100,000 in England and Wales.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 survival rate is less than 99.8%
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims about the Covid-19 vaccines and the disease survival rate shared on Facebook aren’t quite right.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Covid-19 vaccine programme isn’t a medical experiment
fact_check_explanation_summary: The approved vaccines have been through clinical trials, and patients already give informed consent.

fact_check_explanation_title: Santander bank card ‘scam’ probably doesn’t exist
fact_check_explanation_summary: Tens of thousands of people have shared warnings about the scam on Facebook, but it doesn’t seem to be real.

fact_check_explanation_title: US rapper Pitbull wrong to claim Event 201 was ‘rehearsal’ for coronavirus pandemic
fact_check_explanation_summary: Footage of the singer making claims about the origin of the coronavirus pandemic is being widely shared on social media.

fact_check_explanation_title: We don’t know how much Test and Trace affects the spread of Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: Estimates for the effect of the programme on reducing Covid cases include some things that would have happened anyway.

fact_check_explanation_title: Did EU exports really drop 68% in January?
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is other evidence that trade did not fall this much and it may have been driven by stockpiling before January and Covid.

fact_check_explanation_title: Evidence doesn’t show 400,000 people have long Covid ‘right now’
fact_check_explanation_summary: Layla Moran’s claim about people who suffer symptoms for 12 weeks or more is not accurately calculated.

fact_check_explanation_title: A Bangladesh study doesn’t show that depression follows Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Telegraph misreported a scientific study which found that many former Covid-19 sufferers had depression, but did not say whether the virus was to blame.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid vaccine hasn't caused increase in care home deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: The vaccination programme started at around the same time as the recent wave of Covid-19 deaths.

fact_check_explanation_title: Study doesn’t say most vapers are 17% more likely to transmit Covid
fact_check_explanation_summary: The research actually found a lower risk of transmission from vaping than from talking or coughing.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 survival rate is not 99.991% for under 60s
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely shared video on Facebook makes incorrect claims about coronavirus death data.

fact_check_explanation_title: Labour’s figures on the cladding crisis are far too high
fact_check_explanation_summary: The real number of people who might be financially affected by new fire regulations may be about a tenth of Labour’s claim.

fact_check_explanation_title: Evidence doesn’t show 20,000 people ‘sick with Covid’ fail to self-isolate every day
fact_check_explanation_summary: Jonathan Ashworth’s claim is a misunderstanding of figures used by Test and Trace boss Dido Harding.

fact_check_explanation_title: False death figures go viral
fact_check_explanation_summary: An Instagram post claims the Covid-19 death toll up to week 47 of 2020 is 30,000 lower than it actually is.

fact_check_explanation_title: Some people have died after Covid-19 vaccination—not because of it
fact_check_explanation_summary: When a death is reported on the US VAERS system, it does not mean it was caused by the Covid vaccine

fact_check_explanation_title: Ipsos MORI isn’t trying to kill you with Covid tests
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral video on social media warns people against taking part in Ipsos MORI Covid testing studies.

fact_check_explanation_title: People giving Covid-19 vaccines won’t be tried as war criminals
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video claims the roll-out is part of an experiment where the subjects haven’t consented, which is wrong.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence that nanoparticles in Covid-19 vaccines affect fertility
fact_check_explanation_summary: Nanoparticles are the general term for very small particles.

fact_check_explanation_title: ONS death figures not averaged correctly
fact_check_explanation_summary: Deaths in December 2020 appeared far lower than the previous five-year average. That was because the ‘five-year average’ had not been averaged.

fact_check_explanation_title: Penicillin allergies don’t rule out Pfizer vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on social media claims that a penicillin allergy can cause a bad reaction to the Pfizer Covid vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fake letter from Cabinet Office spreads on social media
fact_check_explanation_summary: A letter falsely claiming to come from the Cabinet Office has been widely shared.

fact_check_explanation_title: Keir Starmer did want the UK to remain in the European Medicines Agency
fact_check_explanation_summary: He expressed this opinion on at least two occasions, in 2017.

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s no proof steam inhalation cures Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: An Italian study saying it could be effective only had 10 participants.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pfizer vaccine effective, though not as effective as newspapers suggest
fact_check_explanation_summary: Just 0.04% of Israelis who received the Covid-19 vaccination later caught the disease, but this doesn’t mean the vaccine is 99.96% effective.

fact_check_explanation_title: HS2 will not cost Scotland £17 billion
fact_check_explanation_summary: In effect, all money spent by Scotland on HS2 is returned through the Barnett formula.

fact_check_explanation_title: 53 people have not died in Gibraltar because of the Covid-19 vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: The territory has had 70 Covid-19 deaths overall and 6 have died since getting the vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: “Article 42” of Magna Carta only existed for a short time
fact_check_explanation_summary: It appeared in the original 1215 version of the document, but this was quickly overturned.

fact_check_explanation_title: Warnings over NHS coronavirus vaccine scam email
fact_check_explanation_summary: The scam attempts to take financial information from members of the public.

fact_check_explanation_title: Adolescents have been recruited for Covid-19 vaccine trials in the US
fact_check_explanation_summary: 2,000 children aged between 12 and 15 have been recruited onto the trial, with parental consent.

fact_check_explanation_title: Post comparing the living wage and pensions needs context
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely shared post on Facebook compares the living wage and state pension.

fact_check_explanation_title: Flu deaths aren’t being miscategorised as Covid-19 deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: There are good reasons why the flu season is genuinely mild this year, including record vaccination rates and improved hygiene.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral influencer video full of false Covid-19 claims
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely shared video on social media makes a number of incorrect and misleading statements about the pandemic.

fact_check_explanation_title: Report of 8% vaccine efficacy for elderly is unreliable
fact_check_explanation_summary: A report in German newspaper Handelsblatt claimed that the AstraZeneca vaccine was only 8% effective among over 65s.

fact_check_explanation_title: One in six may refuse the Covid-19 vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: New research suggests that people were not confused by the wording of a survey last summer

fact_check_explanation_title: Some pensioners still receive a free TV licence
fact_check_explanation_summary: An extremely viral post contrasts TV licence changes for the over-75s with DJ Zoe Ball’s pay cheque.

fact_check_explanation_title: Several coronavirus claims made by MP in newspaper are inaccurate
fact_check_explanation_summary: David Warburton MP made a number of claims about Covid-19 statistics in an article for the Somerset County Gazette.

fact_check_explanation_title: There isn’t pork in Covid-19 vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is also no reason to believe the vaccine will impact male fertility as claimed. It may actually help protect it.

fact_check_explanation_title: Death rate back to early 2000s levels
fact_check_explanation_summary: The death rate fell considerably over the past two decades, as life expectancy improved. 2020 saw these improvements reversed.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral posts about missing girl are false, again
fact_check_explanation_summary: Posts are spreading on social media claiming the same girl is missing from multiple areas.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video falsely claims PCR tests insert ‘nanoparticles’ into brain
fact_check_explanation_summary: The video on social media is wrong to suggest it is dangerous to be tested for Covid-19.

fact_check_explanation_title: A “new” pink and blue planet is not real (sadly)
fact_check_explanation_summary: It is an imaginary scene generated by a computer programme.

fact_check_explanation_title: 73,444 deaths registered in 2020 in England and Wales had Covid-19 as the underlying cause
fact_check_explanation_summary: In 2020, 73,444 deaths were registered in England and Wales with Covid-19 as the underlying cause.

fact_check_explanation_title: Clearing up some of the confusion over free school meals
fact_check_explanation_summary: Schools are required to provide lunches to eligible pupils either directly or using vouchers.

fact_check_explanation_title: A kiwi fruit did not test “positive” for Covid
fact_check_explanation_summary: If we stick to using rapid tests on humans, they very rarely give false positives.

fact_check_explanation_title: What you need to know about the claims 23 people died after getting the Covid-19 vaccine in Norway
fact_check_explanation_summary: Norwegian officials suspect common side effects like nausea may have contributed to the deaths in very frail patients.

fact_check_explanation_title: We don’t know whether teachers are more likely to catch Covid
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that infections among teachers are up to 333% above the average use incomparable datasets

fact_check_explanation_title: Do you need to carry proof if you’re exempt from wearing a mask?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The government says you don’t need to carry proof by law but the police union says you might need to show it to avoid a fine.

fact_check_explanation_title: The government spent £63,000 on influencer marketing for Test and Trace
fact_check_explanation_summary: They paid 42 social media stars, including Shaughna Phillips.

fact_check_explanation_title: You don’t need your NHS number to get a Covid-19 vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely shared post on social media claims people who don’t know their NHS number are causing a ‘bottleneck’.

fact_check_explanation_title: There are excess deaths in England and these PHE reports don’t prove otherwise
fact_check_explanation_summary: Reporting lags over Christmas distorted Public Health England’s estimates, which have since been updated.

fact_check_explanation_title: The laws introducing a third English lockdown do not make the Covid-19 vaccine mandatory
fact_check_explanation_summary: Parliament did vote on new regulations on Wednesday, but these new rules didn’t make vaccines mandatory.

fact_check_explanation_title: Flawed comparisons between test and trace systems go viral
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims suggesting the system in England costs vastly more than those in Wales and Ireland uses incomparable figures.

fact_check_explanation_title: More people are dying than usual at the moment
fact_check_explanation_summary: Dr John Lee claimed on talkRADIO that the number of deaths is below the long-term average, but this isn’t true.

fact_check_explanation_title: A satirical caption in a South African newspaper under a picture of a British woman getting the vaccine has caused confusion
fact_check_explanation_summary: The photo of a woman getting a Covid-19 vaccine has been used as evidence that the media is lying to people.

fact_check_explanation_title: Millions—not thousands—caught Covid last year
fact_check_explanation_summary: Doctors only report a small fraction of Covid infections through the NOIDs system.

fact_check_explanation_title: The time on Boris Johnson’s watch does not prove his televised address wasn’t live
fact_check_explanation_summary: The watch appears upside down to the viewer, but shows 8pm.

fact_check_explanation_title: The government has awarded a contract to develop technology that proves you’ve recently had a negative Covid-19 test
fact_check_explanation_summary: This doesn’t mean that vaccination passports are planned.

fact_check_explanation_title: 2020, the year QAnon aligned with the UK’s fears
fact_check_explanation_summary: Conspiracies that have come to define QAnon in 2020, such as distrust of authority and vaccine scepticism, have always been a big part of UK conspiracy culture.

fact_check_explanation_title: The needles in some syringes are supposed to ‘disappear’
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some syringes have a spring which retracts the needle once the dose is administered.

fact_check_explanation_title: Some on the Pfizer vaccine trials did get Bell’s palsy, but not more than we’d expect by chance
fact_check_explanation_summary: Four volunteers developed Bell’s palsy after getting a Covid-19 vaccine, but this doesn’t mean they are linked.

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s no evidence the Pfizer vaccine interferes with the placenta
fact_check_explanation_summary: One expert said the possibility was ‘vanishingly small’.

fact_check_explanation_title: PPE: What actually happened during the first wave?
fact_check_explanation_summary: FOI data from NHS trusts reveals the central supply chain used data that didn’t always show the picture on the ground when sending out PPE stock.

fact_check_explanation_title: Can we believe the lockdown sceptics?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Evidence does not support the theories of sceptics Peter Hitchens, Ivor Cummins and Mike Yeadon

fact_check_explanation_title: How to check claims about tariffs and trade
fact_check_explanation_summary: Knowing which tariffs to pay and what rules to follow is vital for businesses. Misinformation about tariff rates can be used to mislead the public. Here’s how to understand what’s …

fact_check_explanation_title: Survey doesn’t show voters ditching Conservatives over bike lanes
fact_check_explanation_summary: A survey by the campaign group Fair Fuel UK was covered by The Mail on Sunday, but has several flaws.

fact_check_explanation_title: The problem with coronavirus transmission in hospitals
fact_check_explanation_summary: Full Fact investigates what we know about Covid-19 transmission in hospitals, and what we don’t.

fact_check_explanation_title: A post about coronavirus vaccines gets facts about their safety, ingredients, and legality wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: Many of the claims in this post are common myths about the vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Putting outsourced contact tracing spend in context
fact_check_explanation_summary: Spend on contact tracing is a small part of Test and Trace. As of October, roughly the same amount had been spent on national and local authority tracing efforts.

fact_check_explanation_title: Why are people not self-isolating?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Sir Keir Starmer and other Labour MPs claim that people are breaking the rules because they cannot afford to follow them, but this is not what the evidence says

fact_check_explanation_title: Cambridge Covid-19 test results don’t mean PCR tests are inaccurate
fact_check_explanation_summary: A higher ratio of false positives to true positives are expected when viral prevalence in the community drops.

fact_check_explanation_title: False claims about first vaccine recipients spread on social media
fact_check_explanation_summary: Posts claim that CNN used a picture of one of the first vaccine recipients back in October. They did not.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims about the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine ingredients lack evidence
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims about PEG, non-neutralizing antibodies, fertility and late effects have been made about the first Covid-19 vaccine approved in the UK.

fact_check_explanation_title: School funding hasn’t increased by £5k per pupil
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Conservative Party has made incorrect claims about education spending on social media.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine affects women’s fertility
fact_check_explanation_summary: The vaccine causes an immune response to a spike protein, but this almost certainly won’t make the body attack the placenta.

fact_check_explanation_title: The new vaccination card is not a ‘Covid passport’
fact_check_explanation_summary: It is a vaccine record card with appointment details, but no secure identifying information

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaccine approval isn’t quicker because of Brexit
fact_check_explanation_summary: The MHRA could have given the Pfizer vaccine the same emergency approval when the UK was in the EU.

fact_check_explanation_title: Telegraph wrong on Whitty and Vallance statements
fact_check_explanation_summary: Allison Pearson claimed Chris Whitty and Patrick Vallance cherry-picked rising hospital bed occupancy figures in the coronavirus briefing last week. They didn’t.

fact_check_explanation_title: Mersey Care has only had five Covid-19 deaths because it is not an acute trust
fact_check_explanation_summary: This is the second time we’ve seen FOI requests on Covid-19 deaths sent to trusts who are unlikely to deal with seriously ill coronavirus patients.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 is an infectious disease, and a video claiming it isn’t is wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: The woman in this video is wrong to blame radiation—and wrong about other things as well

fact_check_explanation_title: The Pfizer Covid-19 candidate vaccine is not too cold to be called a vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Ebola vaccine had to be stored at temperatures this low too.

fact_check_explanation_title: Is the UK's trade deal with Japan better than the EU's?
fact_check_explanation_summary: We don’t know how much better the UK-Japan trade deal is compared to the EU-Japan deal, but it isn’t expected to be worse.

fact_check_explanation_title: RNA Covid-19 vaccines will not change your DNA
fact_check_explanation_summary: Several candidate vaccines use this technology.

fact_check_explanation_title: This is a real letter from an NHS trust that dealt with no Covid-19 deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: The trust provides community, mental health, and disability services.

fact_check_explanation_title: There are no foetal cells in the AstraZeneca Covid-19 vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: Cells derived from human foetal cells used in production don’t make it to the final product.

fact_check_explanation_title: Nadine Dorries says email from her office on vaccines does not reflect her views
fact_check_explanation_summary: The MP has said the email was sent by a new staff member and didn’t represent her view or government policy.

fact_check_explanation_title: GPs and other frontline medical workers will be among the first to receive a Covid-19 vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: The government has published plans on who will be vaccinated first.

fact_check_explanation_title: Danish study on mask efficacy only tells us half the story
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Spectator article suggests a new study which found mask-wearing didn’t lower Covid-19 infection rates is proof masks don’t work. But the study didn’t look at whether masks help others.

fact_check_explanation_title: Research suggesting increased Covid-19 risk for dog-owners may be barking up the wrong tree
fact_check_explanation_summary: The research claims dog walkers have a higher risk of catching Covid-19 but it has a number of methodological flaws.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Daily Mail’s chart of Covid-19 death figures doesn’t use the real numbers
fact_check_explanation_summary: The chart of weekly deaths claimed to show that deaths were barely higher than previous years, but the figures are wrong.

fact_check_explanation_title: This picture of a vaccine vial from March 2020 is real
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Oxford vaccine has been in development since January 2020.

fact_check_explanation_title: The government plans to monitor potential adverse reactions to a Covid-19 vaccine, but that doesn’t mean it won’t be safe
fact_check_explanation_summary: The government needs a system for logging any medical problems that people encounter at the same time as the vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: The number of deaths from flu and pneumonia is about what you would expect this year
fact_check_explanation_summary: Although there are fewer of these deaths than usual, the fall is neither unexpected, nor extreme

fact_check_explanation_title: A picture of the Titanic sinking is not a newly discovered photograph
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s a painting from 1996, by an artist who worked on the film.

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s too early to say how many suicides have happened during the pandemic
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on social media claims without evidence that suicide deaths have been higher than coronavirus deaths in the last two months.

fact_check_explanation_title: Baseless claims about vaccine safety go viral on Facebook
fact_check_explanation_summary: The post claims that the Covid-19 death rate is much lower than the estimated 0.5%-1% and makes baseless claims that a vaccine would kill more people than the virus.

fact_check_explanation_title: Martin Lewis and City of London Police have not warned about a scam involving banks and mobile networks
fact_check_explanation_summary: This claim has been circulating since at least March 2020.

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s misleading to compare the effectiveness of Covid-19 vaccines and the death rate
fact_check_explanation_summary: Vaccines don’t just prevent death.

fact_check_explanation_title: This post does not show photo of a giant eagle in Scotland
fact_check_explanation_summary: The photo appears to have originally been taken in South Carolina.

fact_check_explanation_title: The number of people dying right now is not the same as in any other year
fact_check_explanation_summary: It was also claimed on talkRADIO that deaths from other respiratory diseases have simply been “replaced“ with Covid-19.

fact_check_explanation_title: The infection fatality rate for Covid-19 is higher than 0.1%
fact_check_explanation_summary: Toby Young missed that a study he was citing had already calculated an IFR for Covid.

fact_check_explanation_title: The figure for a dose of a potential Covid-19 vaccine covers the cost of delivering the treatment
fact_check_explanation_summary: GP practices are private companies that receive funding from a range of places.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ticketmaster won’t demand proof of a Covid-19 vaccine for concert entry
fact_check_explanation_summary: The company said decisions about entry requirements for events will be up to individual organisers

fact_check_explanation_title: No, contact tracing doesn’t cost £10,000 per contact
fact_check_explanation_summary: The claim made by Independent SAGE is based on the £12 billion cost of the test and trace programme, which is mostly testing not tracing.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Covid-19 recovery rate is not 99.9%
fact_check_explanation_summary: Posts on social media have overestimated the Covid recovery rate.

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s no evidence that mercury-based chemicals in a Covid-19 vaccine would cause harm
fact_check_explanation_summary: Thiomersal is no longer found in most standard vaccines and even if it was used in a Covid-19 vaccine there is no evidence it causes harm.

fact_check_explanation_title: How accurate are the new rapid lateral flow tests?
fact_check_explanation_summary: New trial results show rapid lateral flow tests return very few false positives but a considerable number of false negatives.

fact_check_explanation_title: New data doesn’t definitively show zero increase in suicides across England
fact_check_explanation_summary: Early figures from a few areas of England on suicides since the pandemic began may not represent the whole country.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence aluminium in vaccines causes Alzheimer's disease
fact_check_explanation_summary: Small amounts of aluminium have been used in vaccines for almost 100 years.

fact_check_explanation_title: The government is not proposing to make a Covid-19 vaccine mandatory
fact_check_explanation_summary: Evidence submitted to the human rights committee by four academics has been misunderstood.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Covid-19 virus has been isolated many times
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that the Covid-19 virus has not been isolated, and therefore tests for it do not work, are unfounded.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral letter on Covid-19 testing in Liverpool school was real but has been withdrawn
fact_check_explanation_summary: The letter was sent without input from the council. A new letter issued to parents asks for consent to test children.

fact_check_explanation_title: Group swab Covid-19 tests do not return positives to people without the virus
fact_check_explanation_summary: Sample pooling is a method being trialled to save time and resources when Covid-19 prevalence is low.

fact_check_explanation_title: Express opinion piece wrong to allege evidence of widespread voter fraud in US elections
fact_check_explanation_summary: A comment piece in the Express wrongly claimed Donald Trump lost the election because of fraudulent votes.

fact_check_explanation_title: Labour MP contact tracing claim at PMQs out by factor of ten
fact_check_explanation_summary: Ruth Jones claimed the contact tracing system in England costs £1,700 per person. This was based on a calculation which was out by a factor of ten.

fact_check_explanation_title: What does the new lockdown mean for childcare in England?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Our readers have asked us how the new lockdown rules affect childcare.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fact-checking claims on coronavirus transmission in schools
fact_check_explanation_summary: Our readers have asked us to look into claims made by the NEU and Skwawkbox about Covid-19 transmission in schools.

fact_check_explanation_title: A Covid-19 vaccine is not being administered via Covid-19 nasal swab tests
fact_check_explanation_summary: Despite the fact that some other animal vaccines are administered via the nose, the Covid-19 swab test is not a Covid-19 vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: “Article 61” of Magna Carta doesn’t allow you to ignore Covid-19 regulations
fact_check_explanation_summary: Clause 61 of the original document set out rules for specific barons. The clause was removed after a year.

fact_check_explanation_title: BBC presenters did remove their poppies as they were wearing them earlier than BBC guidelines allow
fact_check_explanation_summary: BBC guidelines state poppies can be worn from 6am on 31 October.

fact_check_explanation_title: Daily Mirror misrepresents research on public support for Brexit
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Daily Mirror claimed a new poll shows that 62% think Britain was wrong to leave the EU.

fact_check_explanation_title: A comparison of daily deaths from Covid-19 and non-Covid causes is incorrect
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Covid-19 figures are incorrect based on when the claim was made, and we don’t have recent figures for the non-Covid deaths.

fact_check_explanation_title: £24,000 doesn’t represent what most Universal Credit claimants receive
fact_check_explanation_summary: Lee Anderson MP used the figure to argue against all Universal Credit claimants being entitled to free school meals.

fact_check_explanation_title: No, we are not on track for a normal number of deaths this year
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Facebook compares the death toll this year in England in Wales with the UK death toll in previous years to incorrectly suggest we are on course for …

fact_check_explanation_title: The WHO has not decided attending school implies consent for vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: In the UK you can’t be forced to have a vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Soy sauce imports from Japan will not be cheaper next year
fact_check_explanation_summary: The UK already imports soy sauce from Japan tariff-free under the EU-Japan deal.

fact_check_explanation_title: The number of doctors working for the NHS in England has increased in the past year
fact_check_explanation_summary: Even when excluding final year students fast tracked into hospital roles due to the pandemic, the number of doctors has risen.

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s possible to receive financial support above the benefits cap, but this does not apply to the majority of households
fact_check_explanation_summary: Most households receive payments below the benefits cap.

fact_check_explanation_title: This figure for flu deaths is wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral Facebook post claims that the flu killed 64,000 people in 2018. This is incorrect. 64,000 people died in January 2018 in England and Wales of all causes.

fact_check_explanation_title: The asteroid which might enter Earth’s atmosphere on 2 November will not “hit” Earth
fact_check_explanation_summary: NASA says it is so small it would burn up in the atmosphere.

fact_check_explanation_title: A video claiming to be from 1956 did not predict Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: The video is modern and was made after the pandemic began.

fact_check_explanation_title: Old faked picture of Obama and Bin Laden surfaces again
fact_check_explanation_summary: The picture has been edited.

fact_check_explanation_title: Stanley Johnson did write a novel called ‘The Virus’
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Prime Minister’s father wrote the book in 1982.

fact_check_explanation_title: MPs haven’t given themselves a £3,300 pay rise
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post claims New Zealand MPs took a 20% pay cut during the pandemic while UK MPs gave themselves a pay rise.

fact_check_explanation_title: A tube sign expressing solidarity between London and Manchester is not a real sign
fact_check_explanation_summary: The sign states in the top left corner that it is fake.

fact_check_explanation_title: Matt Hancock got the evidence about long Covid wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: Younger people and those with milder illness seem less likely to be affected, according to data from the Covid Symptom Study app

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post about falling flu and pneumonia deaths is wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: The widely shared Facebook post contains a number of inaccuracies about mortality rates.

fact_check_explanation_title: How poverty rates are cherry-picked to score political points
fact_check_explanation_summary: There are so many ways to measure poverty that it is hard to know what’s really going on—as MPs proved on Wednesday.

fact_check_explanation_title: MPs can only claim £25 a day for food if they stay overnight outside London or their constituency
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral post on Twitter claimed they can claim this every day and that it amounts to over £800,000. It doesn’t.

fact_check_explanation_title: PTFE in masks does not pose a health risk, unless you get it very hot
fact_check_explanation_summary: PTFE heated to high temperatures can cause sickness, but this is rare, and unlikely to be caused by normal mask-wearing.

fact_check_explanation_title: The inventor of PCR never said it wasn’t designed to detect infectious diseases
fact_check_explanation_summary: Rumours about the inventor of the process of PCR, which is used to test whether someone currently has Covid-19, have been spreading on social media.

fact_check_explanation_title: Dominic Raab did not say Covid-19 tests have a 93% false positive rate
fact_check_explanation_summary: Mr Raab was referring to a PHE report on testing at airports and seems to have misspoken when he mentioned false positives.

fact_check_explanation_title: This post telling healthy people to stop getting tested is full of inaccuracies
fact_check_explanation_summary: The post cites inaccurate claims about how testing and virus levels are measured.

fact_check_explanation_title: This video makes a number of inaccurate claims about the Covid-19 pandemic
fact_check_explanation_summary: We have seen similar claims before about Pirbright, Serco, and the Test and Trace system.

fact_check_explanation_title: Labour’s tweet about Serco is missing some important context
fact_check_explanation_summary: Public and private contact tracers do different kinds of work, so it is difficult to compare their performance.

fact_check_explanation_title: Non-Covid deaths in private homes are up, but have decreased elsewhere
fact_check_explanation_summary: Metro claimed the non-Covid death toll is soaring. This refers just to deaths in private homes, not all deaths.

fact_check_explanation_title: Some Covid-positive students are being recorded at their home addresses
fact_check_explanation_summary: The government confirms students who do not register with a new GP at university are recorded as testing positive at their home address.

fact_check_explanation_title: What does an "Australia style" Brexit deal really mean?
fact_check_explanation_summary: On Sunday, Andrew Marr suggested that an “Australian terms” deal with the EU could well be called “Afghan” terms. Afghanistan actually has more favourable trade terms with the EU than …

fact_check_explanation_title: London Mayor candidate wrong to claim Covid-19 pandemic is no worse than a flu season
fact_check_explanation_summary: The number of deaths from Covid-19 far exceeds the number of deaths from flu in a given season, despite the much stricter controls in place.

fact_check_explanation_title: WhatsApp messages about a video called “India is doing it” are a hoax
fact_check_explanation_summary: The video and the hack mentioned in the message are not real.

fact_check_explanation_title: Contact tracing has not stopped in schools
fact_check_explanation_summary: Single Covid-19 cases in educational settings are being traced centrally, instead of by local teams

fact_check_explanation_title: What do lockdown restrictions mean for relationships around the UK?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Readers have asked Full Fact to explain how lockdown rules impact their relationships.

fact_check_explanation_title: Royal Navy sailors died while preventing the slave trade, but not tens of thousands
fact_check_explanation_summary: Modern and contemporary records of naval deaths are in the low thousands.

fact_check_explanation_title: There almost certainly aren’t as many as two million unauthorised immigrants in the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: A recent estimate put the figure between 800,000 and 1.2 million.

fact_check_explanation_title: Andy Burnham was wrong about furlough on Question Time
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Mayor of Greater Manchester suggested that staff in closed pubs and bars in Bolton had no access to support.

fact_check_explanation_title: Flu and Covid-19 statistics are being published in one report, but not added together
fact_check_explanation_summary: They will both now appear in the same weekly document.

fact_check_explanation_title: Flu and Covid-19 statistics are not being added together
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s just that they are both now published in the same weekly document.

fact_check_explanation_title: It's not true that data on causes of death isn't published
fact_check_explanation_summary: Acclaimed author Frederick Forsyth claimed incorrectly that the ONS doesn’t show where Covid-19 ranks among all causes of death.

fact_check_explanation_title: This comparison of the cost of the Irish and UK contact tracing systems is misleading
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Irish system will cost €700 million for the first year, not £773,000 which is just the cost of developing the app.

fact_check_explanation_title: How to spot misleading images online
fact_check_explanation_summary: Here are examples of image-based misinformation we’ve encountered in our work, and advice on how to verify things you may encounter every day.

fact_check_explanation_title: Shamima Begum is not back in the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: This claim regularly reappears and has always been false.

fact_check_explanation_title: This viral post on benefits and tax avoidance is inaccurate
fact_check_explanation_summary: It underestimates the spending on benefits for people seeking asylum and uses a disputed estimate of the tax gap to talk about tax avoidance.

fact_check_explanation_title: What did Rishi Sunak actually say about people in the arts?
fact_check_explanation_summary: ITV claimed the Chancellor suggested that people working in the arts sector should retrain and find other jobs.

fact_check_explanation_title: How the government performed on its autumn testing targets
fact_check_explanation_summary: One target was met before it was announced. The data has not been published that would let us check the other.

fact_check_explanation_title: Crime in London has risen less than the rest of England since 2016
fact_check_explanation_summary: Police recorded crime per person in London is up 18% since 2016. Across England it is up 31%.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson makes an error about quarantine payments
fact_check_explanation_summary: It is £500 for the whole period of self-isolation, not £500 per week.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ordinary colds and flu aren’t the reason for rising Covid-19 cases
fact_check_explanation_summary: We are not mistaking normal autumn illness for a “second wave”

fact_check_explanation_title: Challenging someone for not wearing a face mask isn’t against the Equality Act
fact_check_explanation_summary: It has been claimed on social media that challenging someone who is not wearing a face covering could result in a fine.

fact_check_explanation_title: A picture of Sadiq Khan just before his flu jab doesn’t show he didn’t get it
fact_check_explanation_summary: A photo of a pharmacist preparing to give the Mayor of London his flu vaccination has gone viral.

fact_check_explanation_title: A Covid-19 diagnostic test won’t pick up other coronaviruses
fact_check_explanation_summary: Antibody tests which detect whether someone had Covid-19 in the past may pick up antibodies to other coronaviruses.

fact_check_explanation_title: What are the facts behind claims of a child-snatching panic on social media?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some claims of gangs trying to steal children seem to be exaggerated.

fact_check_explanation_title: Punishments for not wearing face coverings, not social distancing and  for possessing indecent images of children vary depending on the exact offence
fact_check_explanation_summary: One post comparing punishments has over 20,000 shares on Facebook.

fact_check_explanation_title: Serco didn’t build and does not run the NHS Test and Trace app
fact_check_explanation_summary: Serco has been contracted during the pandemic to assist with facilities management and contact tracing call centres.

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s wrong to say that only 3% of Covid-19 cases are caused by restaurants and pubs
fact_check_explanation_summary: This is a misreading of data on the number of outbreaks or clusters identified by Public Health England.

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s true that women escaping domestic abuse can get a free train ticket in Great Britain if they are travelling to refuge accommodation
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post shared tens of thousands of times makes claims about the Rail to refuge Scheme.

fact_check_explanation_title: What is the guidance on face masks?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Full Fact takes a look at the rules on wearing face coverings.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 has killed more people than obesity in the UK this year
fact_check_explanation_summary: An Instagram post compares recent Covid-19 and obesity mortality rates which are not representative of the wider picture.

fact_check_explanation_title: How quickly is the outbreak growing?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Government scientists warned that new cases could double every week, which some people say is not realistic.

fact_check_explanation_title: People did die of Covid-19 in Ireland in August
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral post compares the number of deaths from cancer, suicide, alcohol and Covid-19 in Ireland, but it gets a lot wrong.

fact_check_explanation_title: How does a Covid-19 test work?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The common cold will not produce a positive result on a Covid-19 diagnostic test.

fact_check_explanation_title: The government is not planning to roll out an untested Covid-19 vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: A government consultation about unlicensed vaccines has been misunderstood online.

fact_check_explanation_title: Almost all of these claims about viruses are wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: Posts claiming that viruses are just dead material and the body contains many viruses don’t disprove the fact that Covid-19 can be very harmful.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pay for some nurses has fallen in real terms since 2010
fact_check_explanation_summary: Real-terms pay for staff at the top of band 5 fell from £33,007 in 2010/11 to £30,112 in real-terms between 2010/11 and 2019/20.

fact_check_explanation_title: Thérèse Coffey did not say starving people were not her concern
fact_check_explanation_summary: The fabricated quote appears to refer to an interview she gave to Sky News where she was asked about Mercy Baguma.

fact_check_explanation_title: This image of the Prime Minister has been altered
fact_check_explanation_summary: An expletive has been added in.

fact_check_explanation_title: This post comparing deaths in August is a guess
fact_check_explanation_summary: We don’t yet have data on the number of deaths from suicide in August 2020.

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s no evidence for how many people took part in ‘Eat Out To Help Out’ or later died from Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post makes misleading claims about the survival rates of people eating in restaurants without masks.

fact_check_explanation_title: This is what the guidelines are for social distancing in parliament.
fact_check_explanation_summary: The guidance includes a maximum number of people in the chamber and remote voting.

fact_check_explanation_title: Photos of ministers together weren’t taken at a ‘Cobra’ meeting
fact_check_explanation_summary: Ministers attending a Cabinet meeting appear to be adhering to workplace Covid guidance.

fact_check_explanation_title: Unlicensed vaccines are not untested
fact_check_explanation_summary: Social media posts claim the government is trying to quietly change the rules on unlicensed vaccines, but they’ve missed the point.

fact_check_explanation_title: Punishment for breaking social distancing and possessing indecent images of children can vary
fact_check_explanation_summary: Fines for breaking ‘rule of six’ start at £50 if paid on time.

fact_check_explanation_title: Lots of people are getting confused over testing figures
fact_check_explanation_summary: Many people in media and politics are mistakenly comparing two different things.

fact_check_explanation_title: Angela Rayner’s testing numbers are not quite right
fact_check_explanation_summary: The numbers she used in PMQs measure different things, and cannot be compared.

fact_check_explanation_title: Data on how far people travel to get a Covid-19 test isn’t all that useful
fact_check_explanation_summary: There are some issues with the data released by the government.

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s no connection between new biometrics legislation and Covid-19 tests
fact_check_explanation_summary: This legislation is to do with biometric data that is of interest to national security

fact_check_explanation_title: What do social distancing laws say about ‘mingling’?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Updates to the coronavirus law and guidance place restrictions on certain gatherings.

fact_check_explanation_title: This viral post understates the risk of Covid-19 infection
fact_check_explanation_summary: It claims the risk of catching Covid-19 is 44 million to one. This is a misreading of the fact that daily infections were 44 per million in England, and have …

fact_check_explanation_title: Instagram post falsely claims there was a plane crash at Gatwick Airport
fact_check_explanation_summary: It used an edited picture of an Emirates aircraft above some houses.

fact_check_explanation_title: £1.5bn GDP boost from UK-Japan trade deal is not on top of existing EU-Japan deal benefits
fact_check_explanation_summary: The UK currently trades with Japan under an EU trade agreement. The economic benefits of the new UK-Japan deal are relative to having no agreement, not to trading under the …

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims the Royal British Legion won’t sell poppies to avoid upsetting ‘minorities’ are false
fact_check_explanation_summary: This incorrect claim appears every year.

fact_check_explanation_title: People deciding not to get tested will not make it look as though coronavirus has been wiped out
fact_check_explanation_summary: Covid-19’s prevalence in the community is measured by more than the number of positive tests.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 kills far more than 0.1% of the people who catch it
fact_check_explanation_summary: The real death rate from Covid-19 is probably about five or ten times higher than 0.1%

fact_check_explanation_title: Testing: Where are we?
fact_check_explanation_summary: With the issue of Covid-19 testing back in the news, we take a look at how the testing programme is currently performing.

fact_check_explanation_title: How many children are missing or trafficked in the UK?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Most missing children cases are resolved quickly and without harm recorded.

fact_check_explanation_title: Matt Hancock gets test and trace figures wrong again
fact_check_explanation_summary: Incorrect - it is 69.4%.

fact_check_explanation_title: The word “robot” comes from Czech, not Greek like GPT-3 claims
fact_check_explanation_summary: GPT-3 is mistaken about the etymology of the word robot.

fact_check_explanation_title: This data does not show tests for coronavirus being ordered pre-2020
fact_check_explanation_summary: Numerous items already used by the medical profession have been reclassified for use with Covid-19 in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic.

fact_check_explanation_title: Advice to clinically extremely vulnerable people varies by local lockdown area
fact_check_explanation_summary: Shielding for the clinically extremely vulnerable has been paused in the UK. That goes for most local lockdown areas, but not Leicester and Blackburn.

fact_check_explanation_title: What do we know about a ‘back to work’ campaign?
fact_check_explanation_summary: There has been confusion over whether the government had ever planned to launch a ‘back to work’ media campaign.

fact_check_explanation_title: These figures for non-Covid deaths aren’t accurate
fact_check_explanation_summary: These figures appear greatly exaggerated.

fact_check_explanation_title: Unlicensed vaccine manufacturers are immune from some, but not all, civil liability
fact_check_explanation_summary: A vaccine manufacturer would still be liable if their unlicensed product was defective.

fact_check_explanation_title: Reopening universities will almost certainly not cause 50,000 deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: This assumes that every student in the UK catches Covid-19 this autumn, and that nothing is done to stop it

fact_check_explanation_title: This is not an image of a naked child “escaping” from Buckingham Palace
fact_check_explanation_summary: This was a viral hoax for a TV show.

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s no evidence the number of people taking their own life fell during the Covid-19 pandemic
fact_check_explanation_summary: Health secretary Matt Hancock was wrong to say figures for England show a decrease in the number of people taking their own life.

fact_check_explanation_title: Figures for people seeking asylum in hotels and veterans sleeping rough are both wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s not true that 48,000 “illegals” are housed in hotels, and estimates of 6,000 veterans sleeping rough are likely to be too high.

fact_check_explanation_title: A graph spreading on Facebook gets it wrong on flu vs Covid deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: Flu is not the underlying cause of deaths in more people than Covid-19.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims of pandemic fall in child anxiety may not apply across the whole country
fact_check_explanation_summary: A study which found that students’ anxiety levels were lower during the pandemic than in October 2019 was conducted among year 9 students in the south west of England.

fact_check_explanation_title: Children in Need is not donating £10 million to Black Lives Matter
fact_check_explanation_summary: The BBC charity is matching Stormzy’s £10m pledge to causes tackling racial inequality in the UK.

fact_check_explanation_title: What do we know about Covid-19 transmission in schools?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The evidence is limited as fewer children have attended school during the pandemic, but broadly suggests that while there is some risk, schools aren’t likely to play a large role …

fact_check_explanation_title: A retracted paper linking 5G and coronavirus with no evidence is doing the rounds on Facebook
fact_check_explanation_summary: The paper, which was retracted days after it was published, did not prove any link between 5G and coronaviruses.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ukrainian soldiers have not died after having an American Covid-19 vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: Six members of the Ukrainian military have died of Covid-19 so far, but that wasn’t anything to do with a vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Comparing tax dodging and benefits for people seeking asylum
fact_check_explanation_summary: MP Zarah Sultana claimed that the super-rich and large corporations dodge £90 billion in tax every year. This is based on an estimate for the tax gap which is much …

fact_check_explanation_title: Matt Hancock misstates the proportion of Test and Trace contacts being reached
fact_check_explanation_summary: Matt Hancock misspoke saying that 79.7% of close contacts of infected people are being reached by test and trace.

fact_check_explanation_title: Flu isn’t the underlying cause of death for more people than Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: Figures from the Office for National Statistics are being widely misunderstood. Flu isn’t the underlying cause of death for more people than Covid-19 at the moment, but pneumonia probably is.

fact_check_explanation_title: Study doesn’t show that children are ‘silent super-spreaders’ of coronavirus
fact_check_explanation_summary: A study into the quantity of Covid-19 carried by some children does not prove they are ‘silent super-spreaders’.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims that Warburtons now gets its wheat from the USA are wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: The company changed suppliers but it will continue to get some of its wheat from the UK and some from Canada.

fact_check_explanation_title: Lowering the state pension age for women won't create four million jobs for young people
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Facebook incorrectly claims that allowing women born in the 1950s to retire at age 60 would create four million jobs for young people.

fact_check_explanation_title: You’re allowed to leave England if you’re self-isolating for 14 days following a trip abroad
fact_check_explanation_summary: Provided you travel directly to your point of departure you can travel from England during the 14 day quarantine period.

fact_check_explanation_title: Infrared thermometers do not affect the pineal gland
fact_check_explanation_summary: These thermometers do not emit infrared radiation, they measure it.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral Facebook post on cost of “binned” test and trace app is wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: The app hasn’t been binned, although the government did change direction with their original app to instead use the Google/Apple system.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral Facebook post compares the national living wage with the state pension
fact_check_explanation_summary: The post uses an average figure for the poorest pensioners and compares that to the minimum wage for people over 25.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims that a 2011 lightning composite picture were taken in the Lake District are false
fact_check_explanation_summary: A photo went viral after a Facebook user claimed it was taken in Calbeck, but they later said that was a joke.

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s not true that migrants get a free TV licence
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely shared post on Facebook incorrectly claims migrants who arrive in Britain receive a free TV licence, while pensioners have to pay for one.

fact_check_explanation_title: You cannot catch Legionnaires’ disease from a mask
fact_check_explanation_summary: Legionnaires’ disease is a bacterial infection caught through water.

fact_check_explanation_title: Charles Bronson has not attacked Ian Huntley in prison
fact_check_explanation_summary: The men are in two different prisons.

fact_check_explanation_title: This is not a photo of people seeking asylum in England
fact_check_explanation_summary: The photo was taken in Germany before the coronavirus pandemic.

fact_check_explanation_title: A Lee Rigby charity football Facebook page was taken down due to a hacking attempt
fact_check_explanation_summary: Facebook said that the page has now been reinstated.

fact_check_explanation_title: mRNA vaccines are being developed for Covid-19, but they do not change your DNA
fact_check_explanation_summary: mRNA works by instructing cells, not altering DNA.

fact_check_explanation_title: Gavin Williamson did not say pupils will be overpromoted into jobs that are beyond their competence
fact_check_explanation_summary: Comments about A-level results incorrectly attributed to the Education Secretary have been widely shared.

fact_check_explanation_title: Can children be detained without their parents’ consent if the authorities think they have coronavirus?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The government has said a parent, carer or legal guardian must be present for a Covid-19 screening to take place on a child under the Coronavirus Act, but the law …

fact_check_explanation_title: An Express headline on how many working carers fear for their job is flawed
fact_check_explanation_summary: The poll it’s based on didn’t ask if people thought they would get sacked, it asked if they thought they would be forced to leave their jobs.

fact_check_explanation_title: There is no proof you’re more likely to get Covid-19 if you’re tall
fact_check_explanation_summary: It was widely reported that a survey showed men over six foot tall are more likely to be infected with coronavirus. However, the research does not prove this.

fact_check_explanation_title: You were more likely to catch Covid-19 in Spain than the UK in late July.
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral Facebook post claims Spain had a much lower Covid-19 death toll than the UK at the end of July. That’s correct but isn’t the best way to compare …

fact_check_explanation_title: The RSPCA has said that they are worried people will abandon pets because the economic effects of Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: The company said in a press release that they are worried the current economic climate would lead to more abandoned pets.

fact_check_explanation_title: Leicester residents are not being forcibly tested for coronavirus
fact_check_explanation_summary: Leicester City Council said that no one is being forced by them to take Covid-19 tests.

fact_check_explanation_title: These figures for the size of House Of Commons, House of Lords, and the EU parliament are all correct
fact_check_explanation_summary: However, the European Union does have lawmakers that aren’t elected by the public.

fact_check_explanation_title: How to check coronavirus cases near you
fact_check_explanation_summary: Local coronavirus case data is easy to find, but needs to be read carefully

fact_check_explanation_title: Video of police officer egged by children is a prank
fact_check_explanation_summary: Viral videos on social media seemingly showing a police officer lying on the ground while children pelt him with eggs are not what they seem.

fact_check_explanation_title: We do not test 330,000 people a day for Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: The true number of people tested for Covid-19 each day, under the Test and Trace programme for England, is about 52,000

fact_check_explanation_title: Why this poll gives a misleading view on how many people the public think Covid-19 has killed
fact_check_explanation_summary: By using a mean average, the results overstated what the average Brit thinks the death rate has been.

fact_check_explanation_title: Universal Credit monthly allowance is more than House of Lords daily allowance – for now
fact_check_explanation_summary: Temporary increases to Universal Credit introduced because of the coronavirus pandemic mean the monthly allowance is now higher than the daily allowance for peers in the House of Lords.

fact_check_explanation_title: What are the quarantine rules if you return to the UK from abroad?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Our readers have asked us to explain the guidance around self-isolating if you have visited another country.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ordinary face masks are not harmful
fact_check_explanation_summary: Mask wearing is not harmful for most people, apart from rare instances involving tight-fitting N95 respirators.

fact_check_explanation_title: A baseless paper that linked skin cells, 5G and coronavirus has been retracted
fact_check_explanation_summary: The paper made claims about how 5G waves could be absorbed by skin cells and produce coronavirus but provided no credible evidence.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post on lockdown rule changes are right for certain parts of England
fact_check_explanation_summary: As of 31 July, the lockdown rules changed for people in Greater Manchester and parts of Lancashire and West Yorkshire.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral Facebook post incorrectly claims that a list of PPE contracts are all unfulfilled
fact_check_explanation_summary: PPE procurement is under scrutiny but claims that all these contracts were unfulfilled is not evidenced.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ian Huntley has not been found dead in his cell
fact_check_explanation_summary: The man who killed two girls in 2002 has not died, as a Facebook post claims.

fact_check_explanation_title: The BBC did not say that the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation is planning to put microchips in Covid-19 vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: The article in question is a speculative article on the future of travel and does not mention microchips.

fact_check_explanation_title: The evidence shows surgical masks do offer protection from Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral video claims surgical masks are “no good” as they don’t offer complete protection to the wearer. Evidence shows masks still have benefits.

fact_check_explanation_title: Shaun Bailey’s comments on the congestion charge lack context
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Conservative London mayoral candidate claimed Sadiq Khan’s decision to raise the congestion charge was his own. It was essentially a requirement of a government bailout package.

fact_check_explanation_title: Washing your glasses with soap can help prevent fogging when wearing a mask
fact_check_explanation_summary: The soap disrupts the surface tension which causes the fogging.

fact_check_explanation_title: Misleading claims on pre-existing conditions and Covid-19 deaths go viral
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post makes a false claim about the Covid-19 death rate.

fact_check_explanation_title: Surgical masks may offer some protection to the wearer from Covid-19 and may stop them from infecting others
fact_check_explanation_summary: Masks may offer some limited protection to the wearer and are likely to protect others if the wearer is infectious.

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s not true that employees who have to quarantine cannot be ‘penalised’
fact_check_explanation_summary: Dominic Raab wrongly claimed people cannot be ‘penalised’ by employers if they have to quarantine after being abroad.

fact_check_explanation_title: You do not have to legally lower your mask for lip-readers
fact_check_explanation_summary: Lowering your mask to assist those who lip-read is allowed, but not legally required.

fact_check_explanation_title: Changes to government Covid-19 death data won’t make a big difference to the overall death count
fact_check_explanation_summary: The government has demanded an urgent review into the way Public Health England calculates the daily death figures from coronavirus.

fact_check_explanation_title: There is no indication that a Covid-19 vaccine will be mandatory or that those who don’t get it will have their movements restricted
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post claims that an app containing a QR code will be used to stop people entering shops or businesses if they haven’t had the vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Many children have been the victims of grooming gangs, but there’s no evidence for a figure of one million
fact_check_explanation_summary: We can’t objectively compare the public response to grooming gangs with Black Lives Matter

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s incorrect to say there was no resistance to safety measures around the Blitz
fact_check_explanation_summary: There are multiple examples of people failing to follow Blitz guidance.

fact_check_explanation_title: The government was wrong on its own data on Covid-19 tests for care homes
fact_check_explanation_summary: Boris Johnson and the Department for Health and Social Care claimed in May 125,000 staff in care settings and 118,000 care home residents had been tested for Covid-19. New data …

fact_check_explanation_title: Layla Moran’s child malnutrition figures are wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: Three hospitals say they had far fewer child malnutrition admissions than was reported. Other questions remain unresolved.

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s not true that 58% of Covid-19 deaths in Scotland were in care homes
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely shared Facebook post wrongly claims that 58% of Scotland’s coronavirus deaths took place in care homes.

fact_check_explanation_title: This letter claiming to be from a doctor in Surrey is full of errors
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims about hospital attendance figures, death certificates, and empty ambulances are all false.

fact_check_explanation_title: Mark Francois did not deny that there is a gender pay gap
fact_check_explanation_summary: This quote appears to be a fabrication.

fact_check_explanation_title: When did lockdown begin in the UK?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Matt Hancock claimed lockdown began a week before Boris Johnson instructed the country to ‘stay at home’.
